info.description: Use WePay's APIs to integrate with [Link](/link), [Clear](/clear), or [Core](/core), and to leverage feature offerings like [Digital Wallets](/digital-wallets) and [Card Present](/card-present).

post.description: The POST /payment_methods call allows your platform to create a payment method. Payment methods represent payment data like credit cards and bank accounts, and allow your platform to charge and accept money from a payer.

parameters.name: WePay-Risk-Token
parameters.description: This header is **required** when tokenizing Payment Methods, Legal Entities, and Payout Methods **when the [tokenization JS library](/sdks-and-libraries/helper-js/) is not being used.**

parameters.name: Client-IP
parameters.description: This header is **required** when tokenizing Payment Methods, Legal Entities, and Payout Methods **when the [tokenization JS library](/sdks-and-libraries/helper-js/) is not being used.**

create_time.description: The UNIX timestamp for when the object was created.

id.description: ID of the object or resource.
The legal entity ID associated with verification document.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

resource.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

shared_owner_response.description: Details the owner resource and owner path associated with the document.

amex_seller_id.description: Seller id assigned by by American Express.

amex_seller_number.description: Service Establishment Number (a.k.a. SE Number) is a unique ten-digit number assigned by American Express to a merchant that accepts American Express cards.

opt_into_marketing.description: A form of permission marketing in which there is a formal opt-in process for receiving follow-up communication, offers, etc.

max_fee_amount.description: The maximum value of total fee amount.

min_fee_amount.description: The minimum value of total fee amount.

variable_fee_bps.description: The basis points to calculate variable fee amount.

accounts_tier.description: The tier pricing model to collect platform fees when the payment method is a payment bank.

accounts_opt_blue_response.description: OptBlue is a payment processing option that allows smaller businesses to accept American Express credit cards.

debit_failure_fee.description: Charge merchants a fee when IC+ fees cannot be debited from their balance or linked payout method.

accounts_other_fees.description: Describe any one-off fees charged to the merchant by your platform.

fixed_fee_markup_amount.description: Define a fixed dollar amount to charge per transaction. This integer value describes the fee in cents, so a value of `2` describes $0.02.

variable_fee_markup_bps.description: Basis points to calculate variable markup fee amount. Basis points translate directly to percent, so a value of `20` here will be calculated as 0.2%, this percentage is charged per transaction.

card_not_present.description: The pricing model to collect platform fees when the payment method is card not present.

social_insurance_number_is_present.description: Indicates if a social insurance number is present. When the boolean values is `true`, it means that the social insurance number has been provided already. When the values is `false`, it means that the social insurance number has not been provided yet.

legal_entities_personal_country_info_CA_.description: Legal entity country information associated with Canada.

legal_entities_personal_country_info_GB_.description: Legal entity country information associated with Great Britain.

legal_entities_personal_country_info_US_.description: Legal entity country information associated with the United States.

beneficial_owner_reference_id.description: A custom reference ID set by the platform to help track and map controllers and additional representatives of a legal entity.

balance.description: A sum of payments, in the given currency, currently available for the next payout. Possible values include: `USD`, `CAD`.

incoming_pending.description: The payment amount received from the payer to be processed or reviewed by WePay.

outgoing_pending.description: The payout balance being processed or reviewed by WePay.

payout_method_id.description: ID of the payout method associated with the USD payout.

x-enumDescriptions.daily: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every day. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.weekly: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every week on Monday. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.monthly: WePay will send the value of an Account's available balance to the linked Payout Method every month on the 1st, and the available balance will then become $0. If an Account's available balance is already $0, then no Payout will be sent.

period.description: Describes the how often a USD payout will occur.

next_payout_time.description: Describes when the next USD payout will occur.

pricing_by_currency-create-CAD_unversion.description: The Merchant IC+ pricing model is not currently supported for merchants based in Canada.

fixed_fee_markup_amount.description: Define a fixed dollar amount to charge per transaction. This integer value describes the fee in cents, so a value of `2` describes $0.02.

variable_fee_markup_bps.description: Basis points to calculate variable markup fee amount. Basis points translate directly to percent, so a value of `20` here will be calculated as 0.2%, this percentage is charged per transaction.

transaction.description: Describe fixed and variable fees to charge merchants per transaction.

fixed_fee_markup_amount.description: Set a fixed amount to charge merchants per credit card authorization attempt, regardless of down-stream approval or decline. This integer value describes the fee in cents, so a value of `2` describes $0.02.

auth.description: Describe fixed fees to charge merchants per authorization, regardless of success or decline.

chargeback_amount.description: A fixed amount to charge the merchant per credit card chargeback they receive, defined by the Partner.

refund_fee_for_transaction_markup.description: Flag to charge Merchant IC+ merchants for refund. If set to true, merchants are charged the fixed markup (the value of `transaction.fixed_fee_markup_amount`) of the original transaction per refund.

interchange_plus.description: The interchange plus pricing model for credit cards to collect platform markup fees.

max_fee_amount.description: The maximum value of total fee amount.

min_fee_amount.description: The minimum value of total fee amount.

variable_fee_bps.description: The basis points to calculate variable fee amount.

refund_fee_for_standard.description: Flag to charge Merchant IC+ merchants refunds against ACH/eCheck transactions. If set to `true`, merchants are charged the `fixed_fee_amount` of the original transaction per refund.

standard.description: The standard pricing model to collect platform fees when the payment method is a payment bank.

amount.description: Describe the amount of fees to be charged at each interval.

period.description: Describe the interval as which recurring fees should be charged.

recurring_fee.description: Describe any regularly recurring fees charged to the merchant by your platform. These are typically fees charged for services rendered by your platform. **This fee is only to be charged while the merchant is active on your platform. You must provide merchants a method to close their account and stop incurring this fee.**

model.description: This model is used to specify the model number of the equipment being shipped to the merchant.

unit_amount.description: This is the amount that will be charged for each equipment unit.  This integer value describes the fee in cents, so a value of `2` describes $0.02.

period.description: This is the period over which the unit amount will be charged. This can be “daily”, “weekly”, “monthly”, “quarterly”, or “annual“. This field is required if the unit_amount is greater than zero.

x-enumDescriptions.monthly: Indicates that the hardware fee is charged monthly.

hardware.description: This model is used to specify the POS equipment and its pricing being shipped to the merchant.

name.description: Name of the merchant account; use the "Doing Business As" title for the merchant. Must not contain the word `wepay`. **Note:** Account names can include any regex word character.

unit_amount.description: Specify the name of the service being provided to the merchant

period.description: This is the period over which the unit amount will be charged. This can be “daily”, “weekly”, “monthly”, “quarterly”, or “annual“. This field is required if the unit_amount is greater than zero.

x-enumDescriptions.monthly: Indicates that the service fee is charged monthly.

services.description: This model is used to specify the services and its pricing being rendered to the merchant.

equipment_fees.description: This model is used to specify pricing of equipment and services provided to the merchant.

pricing_by_currency-create-GBP.description: The Merchant IC+ pricing model is not currently supported for merchants based in the UK.

city.description: City associated with the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

line1.description: Address of the Legal Entity. Must not be a PO Box and must begin with a number.

postal_code.description: Postal code associated with the address.

region.description: Region associated with the address. Expected values are state or province abbreviations for addresses in the US or CA. **Note:** for entity and controller address, the following values are not supported: `PR`, `VI`, `AA`, `AE`, and `AP`.

line2.description: Second line of the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

legal_entities_address.description: Address of the legal entity, controller, or additional representatives. When representing the entity's address, send the entity's address of operation. When representing the controller or additional representative send the individual's residential address.

email-nullable.description: Email associated with the person. Note that each domain label (parts that are separated by dots) must not exceed 63 characters.

country_code.description: Country code associated with the legal entity.

phone_number.description: Phone number associated with the legal entity.

enterprise_customer_id.description: The **Chase** ID of the enterprise customer to use as the external resource for legal entity data. **Note:** This parameter requires permission from WePay to use.

resource-legal_entities.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

business_number.description: [Provincial business number](/clear/options/kyc-and-cip-certification/#canadian-business-number-patterns) associated with the legal entity. We are no longer accepting federal business registration numbers.

x-enumDescriptions.sole_proprietor: Merchant is the sole owner of an unincorporated business.
x-enumDescriptions.limited_liability_company: Business is registered with the government as a Limited Liability Company.
x-enumDescriptions.partnership: Business is registered with the government as a partnership and is formed under a partnership agreement.

shared_entity_country_info_CA.description: Legal entity country information associated with Canada.

x-enumDescriptions.individual: An individual without any kind of business or entity filings. **Note:** This legal form is generally unsupported and is being deprecated.
x-enumDescriptions.partnership: Business is registered with the government as a partnership and is formed under a partnership agreement.
x-enumDescriptions.private_limited_company: Business is registered with the government as a Limited Liability Company.

shared_entity_country_info_GB.description: Legal entity country information associated with Great Britain.

x-enumDescriptions.sole_proprietor: Merchant is the sole owner of an unincorporated business and must be given a choice to enter an EIN with the SSN4 or no EIN with their SSN9 during Merchant onboarding.
x-enumDescriptions.limited_liability_company: Business is registered with the government as a Limited Liability Company.
x-enumDescriptions.partnership: Business is registered with the government as a partnership and is formed under a partnership agreement.
x-enumDescriptions.government_entity: Merchant is acting on behalf of a government entity.

shared_entity_country_info_US.description: Legal entity country information associated with the United States.

x-enumDescriptions.CD: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
x-enumDescriptions.GS: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
x-enumDescriptions.MK: Macedonia, the Former Yugoslav Republic of
x-enumDescriptions.XX: Custom code WePay uses for Crimea

verified.description: Indicates if the personal verification details of the controller have been verified.

x-enumDescriptions.additional_documents_required: **Note:** This is the default value for additional information during merchant verification, but can be replaced by `identity_verification` by working with your integration team. This value indicates that the merchant must [upload documentation](/api/#/http/guides/document-upload) to allow WePay to complete verification. [Example notification](https://gist.github.com/wehub/edcae2ecefbd76df9e3b3e6a97a954cf).
x-enumDescriptions.errant_fields: This value describes missing or invalid onboarding information.
x-enumDescriptions.identity_verification: **Note:** Work with your integration team to enable this value, which would then replace `additional_documents_required` and enhance the end user experience. The preferred method is `identity_verification`, so please work with your integration team to get this enabled to replace the `additional_documents_required` value. WePay requires documentation in order to verify the identity of the entity, controller, or one of the additional representatives.
x-enumDescriptions.in_review: WePay must review this merchant, and the capability must be disabled until that review is complete.
x-enumDescriptions.risk_outreach: WePay requires documentation in order to properly implement fraud protection for the merchant.

issue_type.description: Indicates the reason(s) the current issue has appeared.

target.description: Indicates the resource associated with the current issue.

additional_documents_required.description: Indicates if additional documentation is required for this specific path. For instance, if examining `controller.personal_verification.current_issues.additional_documents_required`, then any and all required documentation will be presented in this array.

x-enumDescriptions.is_false: This will return if the `controller.email_is_verified` value is `false`. Find out when a controller's email address must be verified [here](/clear/onboard-merchants/#invite-the-controller), and [here](/clear/options/enable-merchants/#enable-payments) for merchants onboarded without the WePay Merchant Center.
x-enumDescriptions.is_null: The target is required information for onboarding, and the merchant must provide this information to continue processing. Find more information in the [Enable Merchants](/clear/options/enable-merchants/) article.
x-enumDescriptions.is_po_box: Addresses must not be a PO box, but rather a residential or business address.
x-enumDescriptions.is_unsupported_value: If a merchant's category code or currency are not supported for a given capability, this issue type will return.
x-enumDescriptions.includes_dba: Business Legal Name should not include Doing Business As (DBA).
x-enumDescriptions.does_not_match_provided_doc: The value of the target does not match provided documentation.
x-enumDescriptions.does_not_match_government_sources: The value of the target does not match government sources.
x-enumDescriptions.invalid_url: WePay cannot verify the URL. The merchant should double check their website URL and submit it again.

errant_fields.description: Indicates which fields need to be updated.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

in_review.description: Indicates if verification information is under review (if any) for this specific path. For instance, if examining `controller.personal_verification.current_issues.additional_documents_required`, and `in_review` is `true`, then this array will contain the path of the item(s) under review.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

items.description: Returns an array of objects identifying why WePay is unable to verify an entity, controller, or additional representative. If there is a single issue, the array will contain an `issue_type`; a `target` array with identifying details about the object, path, and/or parameter(s) relevant to the issue; and another array containing further details from the value of `issue_type`. This last array's key will match the value from `issue_type` and will be one of: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`. If there are multiple issues, then the above collection of objects and parameters will be returned for each issue.  *Note:* Only *one* of the following object will be present, depending on the value of the `issue_type`: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`.

x-enumDescriptions.illegible: Quality of the file or text in the file was such that the document content could not be read.
x-enumDescriptions.corrupt_file: The file could not be used. The merchant must create a new file and try again.
x-enumDescriptions.info_mismatch: The information in the document did not match the information on file for the merchant. The merchant must provide documents with information pertaining to the business, otherwise re-submit the data provided to WePay.
x-enumDescriptions.doc_unsupported: The provided document does not satisfy the requirement from WePay.
x-enumDescriptions.incomplete: The provided document does not completely satisfy the requirements. Additional documents may be requested.

x-enumDescriptions.failed_risk_review: The provided document failed WePay risk review.

reject_reason.description: Describes the reasons a document was rejected.

x-enumDescriptions.in_review: The document has been received and is currently being reviewed by WePay. Once review is complete, the status will be updated.
x-enumDescriptions.verified: WePay was able to verify the information in the document, and no further action is needed for this specific requirement.
x-enumDescriptions.rejected: WePay was unable to verify the document, so the merchant must address the issues listed in the `reject_reason.detail_code` parameter.

documents.description: The document IDs are returned via the document upload feature in the JavaScript library. These documents will be used for identity verification. Check out Document Upload for more details.

personal_verification.description: Personal information for additional beneficial owners of the legal entity. **Note:** You can pass `{}` to signify that this legal entity does not have any additional representatives.

legal_entities_id_verifications_controll.description: Personal details of the controller.  *Note:* A controller is an individual with significant responsibility to control or manage a legal entity. Examples of controllers include, but are not limited to, a Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Chief Operating Officer, Managing Member, General Partner, President, Vice President, or Treasurer, or any other individual who regularly performs similar functions as part of a control prong.

id.description: The application ID assigned to your platform in the Partner Center. If for the beneficiary field, then the ID of the beneficial owner.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

shared_owner_is_legal_entity_response.description: Details the owner resource and owner path.

accepted_methods.description: An array of accepted payment methods. Possible values include: `american_express`, `discover`, `diners_club`, `jcb`, `mastercard`, `payment_bank`, `visa`.

accounts_incoming_payments_response.description: Identify the payment methods this merchant will accept, and describe this merchant's relationship with card association.

x-enumDescriptions.USD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in US dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.CAD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Canadian dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.GBP: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Great British pounds. **Note:** Not currently supported.

currencies.description: [Merchant IC+ pricing](/pricing/merchant-interchange-plus/) is available exclusively for merchants with a `USD` Account or Blended pricing model.

pricing-create_unversioned.description: The [Merchant IC+ pricing model](/pricing/merchant-interchange-plus/#define-merchant-ic-pricing) and Blended pricing model to collect platform payment fees from the merchant. Your markup fees should be inclusive of WePay processing fees, which will be debited from your platform Account. For any markup that you define, you'll receive that amount less WePay fees. If you choose to have a lower markup than the fees WePay charges, your Account will be debited to cover the difference.

uri-nullable.description: Primary URL of the legal entity.

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code. Possible values include: `CAD` & `USD`. **Note:** as of today, `currency` supports a single value.

accounts_id.description: ID of the merchant account, generated by WePay when the account is created.

uri.description: A valid, publicly available URL that works as an endpoint for HTTPS requests. This cannot be a local host. If for notification preferences, must be HTTPS.

payout_method_id.description: ID of the payout method associated with the USD payout.

x-enumDescriptions.daily: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every day. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.weekly: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every week on Monday. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.monthly: WePay will send the value of an Account's available balance to the linked Payout Method every month on the 1st, and the available balance will then become $0. If an Account's available balance is already $0, then no Payout will be sent.

period.description: Describes the how often a USD payout will occur.

postal_code.description: Postal code associated with the address.

city.description: City associated with the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

line1.description: First line of the address **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

line2.description: Second line of the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

region.description: Region associated with the address. Expected values are state or province abbreviations for addresses in the US or CA. **Note:** for entity and controller address, the following values are not supported: `PR`, `VI`, `AA`, `AE`, and `AP`.

resource-accounts.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

x-enumDescriptions.conveyed: Transactions through AmEx methods of payment must be conveyed (i.e. settled outside of WePay).

debit.description: The contactless payment functionality of Interac® Debit is also called Interac Flash.

max_fee_amount.description: The maximum value of total fee amount.

min_fee_amount.description: The minimum value of total fee amount.

variable_fee_bps.description: The basis points to calculate variable fee amount.

accounts_id_tier_request.description: The tier pricing model to collect platform fees when the payment method is a payment bank.

symbol.description: Ticker symbol of the publicly traded company.

x-enumDescriptions.user: Indicates that the information in this rBit was submitted directly by the user (merchant or payer).
x-enumDescriptions.guidestar: Indicates that the information in this rBit was collected by the partner from GuideStar.
x-enumDescriptions.experian_precise_id: Indicates that the information in this rBit was collected by the partner using Experian Precise ID.
x-enumDescriptions.experian_biz_id: Indicates that the information in this rBit was collected by the partner using Experian BizID.
x-enumDescriptions.experian_biz_iq: Indicates that the information in this rBit was collected by the partner using Experian BizIQ.
x-enumDescriptions.equifax: Indicates that the information in this rBit was collected by the partner using Equifax.
x-enumDescriptions.spokeo: Indicates that the information in this rBit was collected by the prrtner using Spokeo.
x-enumDescriptions.whitepages: Indicates that the information in this rBit was collected by the partner using Whitepages.
x-enumDescriptions.irs_tin_check: Indicates that the information in this rBit was collected by the partner by checking the merchant's TIN with the IRS.
x-enumDescriptions.partner_database: Indicates that the information in this rBit originates from data already existing in the partner's database.
x-enumDescriptions.partner_employee: Indicates that the information in this rBit was provided by an employee of the partner.
x-enumDescriptions.generic_website: Indicates that the information in this rBit was collected by the platform from a generic, publicly available website.

x-enumDescriptions.address: Send this enum value when the rBit is describing an address related to the merchant or transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.auto_billing: Send this enum value when the rBit is describing auto billing related to a transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.business_description: Send this enum value when the rBit is the business description related to the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.business_name: Send this enum value when the rBit is the business name related to the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.external_account: Send this enum value when the rBit is describing an external account associated with to the merchant or payer.
x-enumDescriptions.fundraising_event: Send this enum value when the rBit is providing information about a fundraising event.
x-enumDescriptions.fundraising_update: Send this enum value when the rBit is providing an update about a fundraising campaign or event.
x-enumDescriptions.industry_code: Send this enum value when the rBit is providing an industry code for the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.partner_service: Send this enum value when the rBit is describing a transaction related to services provided by the partner to end users.
x-enumDescriptions.person: Send this enum value when the rBit is describing a person related to the merchant or transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.phone: Send this enum value when the rBit is describing a phone number related to the merchant or transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.transaction_details: Send this enum value when the rBit is providing details about the transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.mfa: Send this enum value when the rBit is providing information about an end user's MFA status.
x-enumDescriptions.project: Information about a project that an invoice or transaction is related to.
x-enumDescriptions.website: The URI to the campaign/website for the associated object.

rbit-types.description: The type of rBit. Use `type` to define how the rBit will be used.

x-enumDescriptions.incorporation: Identifies the address as that of an incorporation.
x-enumDescriptions.headquarters: Identifies the address as the headquarters of the merchant or client.
x-enumDescriptions.satellite: Identifies the address as a satellite office of the merchant or client.
x-enumDescriptions.mail_forwarding: Identifies the address as the mail-forwarding address of the merchant or client.
x-enumDescriptions.home: Identifies the address as the home address of the merchant or client.

rbits_address.description: A mailing address associated with a user or account.

autobill_setup_time.description: The UNIX timestamp when the auto-bill was first set up or last updated by the user.

payment_frequency.description: Describes the frequency of auto-billed payments. Possible values include: `annually`, `monthly`, `quarterly`, `weekly`. **Alternately**, you can specify the number of weeks/ months / years as follows: `1d`, `2d`, `3d`, etc; `1w`, `2w`, `3w`, etc; `1m`, `2m`, `3m`, etc; `1y`, `2y`, `3y`, etc.

payment_number.description: If this is the first payment of an `auto-billing` series of payments, then set the value here to `2`.

x-enumDescriptions.payer: The payer set up and authorized auto-billing.
x-enumDescriptions.merchant: The merchant set up and authorized auto-billing.

setup_by.description: The party who set up auto-billing. Possible values include: `payer`: the payer set up and authorized auto-billing; `merchant`: the merchant set up auto-billing on the payer's behalf.

total_payments_scheduled.description: The number of payments that are scheduled to be auto-billed. For example total_payments_scheduled = 3. If there is no scheduled end to the auto-billed payments, then pass null.

shared_auto_billing.description: The user's card is charged automatically every month.

number_of_employees.description: The number of employees employed by the business.

sales_tax_liability_flag.description: Possible values include: `true`: indicates that this merchant collects sales tax for each transaction; `false`: indicates that this merchant does not collect sales tax for each transaction.

name.description: The full name of the business.

x-enumDescriptions.legal: Indicates that the name sent is the legal name as it appears in IRS filings and other licencing.
x-enumDescriptions.dba: Indicates that the name sent is the commonly known name for a business.

name_type.description: Possible values include: `legal`: the legal name of the company; `dba`: The "Also Known As" or "Doing Business As" name of the company.

shared_business_name.description: The full name of the business.

account_type.description: Name of the provider of the account. If this is an account controlled by your platform, skip this parameter and set the `is_partner_account` parameter to `true`.

is_partner_account.description: Possible values: `false`: the external account is not controlled by your platform; `true`: the external account is controlled by your platform.

connections.description: The number of friends (Facebook) or connections (LinkedIn) the user has.

create_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when external account was created.

feedback_average_score.description: Average feedback score for this user normalized between 0.0 (worst) and 1.0 (best). (Applies to star rating feedback systems.)

feedback_score_percent_positive.description: Percentage of feedback which is positive. (Applies to positive/negative scoring systems.)

feedback_scores_provided.description: Number of times this user has received feedback.

followers.description: The user's number of followers (Twitter) or members in their circles (Google+).

following.description: The number of people the user is following (Twitter) or has in their circles (Google+).

modify_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when external account was modified.

user_id.description: The user's ID of the external account.

event_time.description: The time (in UNIX) of when the event starts.

fundraising_goal.description: The fundraising goal established by the event organizers.

giving_deadline.description: The time (in UNIX) of the deadline when donations will no longer be accepted.

shared_fundraising_event.description: Information about an event related to a donation transaction or donation account.

x-enumDescriptions.merchant_category_code: Indicates that the code sent is an [MCC](/clear/options/mccs/).
x-enumDescriptions.standard_industry_code: Indicates that the code sent is a [Standard Industry Code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_Industrial_Classification).
x-enumDescriptions.north_american_industry_classification_s: Indicates that the code sent is from the [North American Industry Classification System](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_Industry_Classification_System).

shared_industry_code.description: A code from one of several sources that indicates the industry associated with the business.

country_code.description: Country code associated with the legal entity.

phone_number.description: Phone number associated with the legal entity.

x-enumDescriptions.activated: Indicates that MFA has been set up for this user.
x-enumDescriptions.disabled: Indicates that MFA has been disabled for this user.
x-enumDescriptions.updated: Indicates that MFA has been updated for this user.

shared_partner_service.description: This describes one type of service or product the user signed up for on the partner site. This should be passed as a related rbit of the `external_account` rbit that contains partner site information.

x-enumDescriptions.employee: Identifies the person the rBit contains information about as an employee of the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.fundraiser: Identifies the person the rBit contains information about as a fundraiser for the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.fundraising_team_captain: Identifies the person the rBit contains information about as a fundraising team captain for the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.other_third_party: Identifies the person the rBit contains information about as some third party related to the merchant or payer.

shared_person.description: Information about a person associated with a user or account.

country_code.description: Country code associated with the legal entity.

phone_number.description: Phone number associated with the legal entity.

x-enumDescriptions.mobile: Indicates that the phone number is for a mobile device.
x-enumDescriptions.personal: Indicates that the phone number is for a personal device.
x-enumDescriptions.business: Indicates that the phone number is for a business device.

shared_rbits_phone.description: A phone number associated with a user or account.

name.description: Name of the project. This should match the project_name property, if provided, in the receipt_line_item structure.

billing_method.description: Standard values include: hourly_staff_rate, hourly_task_rate, hourly_project_rate and flat_project_amount.

completion_time.description: The Unix epoch time (in seconds) when the project is scheduled to complete.

flat_estimate_amount.description: Estimated total cost of the project.

hourly_estimate.description: Estimated hours needed to complete the project.

shared_project.description: Information about a project that an invoice or transaction is related to.

end_time.description: End time of the revenue measurement period (i.e. for CY2013 revenue, end-time would be 1/1/2014 00:00).

revenue_amount.description: Revenue amount in cents for the specified time-frame, segment, and currency. Amount in the lowest denomination. For example, $1.00 is represented as 100.

start_time.description: Start time of the revenue measurement period (i.e. for CY2013 revenue, start-time would be 1/1/2013 00:00).

x-enumDescriptions.all: total revenue of the entire business.
x-enumDescriptions.partial: one segment of the revenue (for example, revenue from just one channel).

revenue_fraction.description: Two possible values: all: total revenue of the entire business. partial: one segment of the revenue (for example, revenue from just one channel).

x-enumDescriptions.free_form_entry: Indicates that services are being paid for via some generic form (i.e. none of the other listed service billing methods).
x-enumDescriptions.timed_billing_at_staff_rate: Indicates that the total amount of a transaction was calculated by the amount of time worked at the agreed upon price per person.
x-enumDescriptions.timed_billing_at_task_rate: Indicates that the total amount of a transaction was calculated by the amount of time worked at the agreed upon price per task.
x-enumDescriptions.timed_billing_at_project_rate: Indicates that the total amount of a transaction was calculated by the amount of time worked at the agreed upon price per project.
x-enumDescriptions.hourly_billing_at_staff_rate: Indicates that the total amount of a transaction was calculated by the number of hours worked and the hourly rate of each worker.
x-enumDescriptions.hourly_billing_at_task_rate: Indicates that the total amount of a transaction was calculated by the number of hours and the hourly rate of each task.
x-enumDescriptions.hourly_billing_at_project_rate: Indicates that the total amount of a transaction was calculated by the number of hours and the hourly rate of the project.
x-enumDescriptions.flat_project_amount: Indicates that the total amount of a transaction was agreed upon as a flat amount for a given project.

shared_website.description: The URI to the campaign/website for the associated object.

postal_code.description: Postal code associated with the address.

email.description: Email associated with the person. Note that each domain label (parts that are separated by dots) must not exceed 63 characters.

holder_name.description: Name of the person as it appears on the credit card or bank account statement.

reports_account_holder.description: Personal details of the person who owns the credit card or the bank account.

email.description: Email associated with the person. Note that each domain label (parts that are separated by dots) must not exceed 63 characters.

holder_name.description: Name of the person as it appears on the credit card or bank account statement.

reports_card_holder.description: Personal details of the person who owns the credit card or the bank account.

id.description: The merchant account ID.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

shared_item_owner_response.description: Details the owner resource and owner path.

resource-items.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

x-enumDescriptions.kilograms: The item weight is in kilograms.
x-enumDescriptions.pounds: The item weight is in pounds.

accounts_opt_blue_request.description: OptBlue is a payment processing option that allows smaller businesses to accept American Express credit cards.

payout_method_id.description: ID of the payout method associated with the USD payout.

period.description: Describes the how often a USD payout will occur.

next_payout_time.description: Describes when the next USD payout will occur.

pricing_by_currency-resp-CAD.description: The Merchant IC+ pricing model is not currently supported for merchants based in Canada.

fixed_fee_markup_amount.description: Define a fixed dollar amount to charge per transaction. This integer value describes the fee in cents, so a value of `2` describes $0.02.

variable_fee_markup_bps.description: Basis points to calculate variable markup fee amount. Basis points translate directly to percent, so a value of `20` here will be calculated as 0.2%, this percentage is charged per transaction.

transaction.description: Describe fixed and variable fees to charge merchants per transaction.

fixed_fee_markup_amount.description: Set a fixed amount to charge merchants per credit card authorization attempt, regardless of down-stream approval or decline. This integer value describes the fee in cents, so a value of `2` describes $0.02.

auth.description: Describe fixed fees to charge merchants per authorization, regardless of success or decline.

chargeback_amount.description: A fixed amount to charge the merchant per credit card chargeback they receive, defined by the Partner.

refund_fee_for_transaction_markup.description: Flag to charge Merchant IC+ merchants for refund. If set to true, merchants are charged the fixed markup (the value of `transaction.fixed_fee_markup_amount`) of the original transaction per refund.

interchange_plus.description: The interchange plus pricing model for credit cards to collect platform markup fees.

max_fee_amount.description: The maximum value of total fee amount.

min_fee_amount.description: The minimum value of total fee amount.

variable_fee_bps.description: The basis points to calculate variable fee amount.

refund_fee_for_standard.description: Flag to charge Merchant IC+ merchants refunds against ACH/eCheck transactions. If set to `true`, merchants are charged the `fixed_fee_amount` of the original transaction per refund.

standard.description: The standard pricing model to collect platform fees when the payment method is a payment bank.

amount.description: Describe the amount of fees to be charged at each interval.

period.description: Describe the interval as which recurring fees should be charged.

recurring_fee.description: Describe any regularly recurring fees charged to the merchant by your platform. These are typically fees charged for services rendered by your platform. **This fee is only to be charged while the merchant is active on your platform. You must provide merchants a method to close their account and stop incurring this fee.**

x-enumDescriptions.US: Publicly traded companies are currently supported in the United States.

country.description: Country where the stock market is operational.

name.description: Full name of the stock market where the company is traded.

symbol.description: Ticker symbol of the publicly traded company.

contractual_obligation.description: Set to `true` if the beneficiary and the affiliate have contractual obligations to one another.

donor.description: Set to `true` if the affiliate donates to the beneficiary.

funding_recipient.description: Set to `true` if the affiliate receives funding from the beneficiary.

other.description: Describe the association between the affiliate and beneficiary with a string if none in this list are applicable.

parent_organization.description: Set to `true` if the affiliate is the parent organization of the beneficiary.

program_affiliation.description: Set to `true` if the affiliate and beneficiary collaborate on a program together.

resource_delivery_provider.description: Set to `true` if the affiliate delivers resources to the beneficiary.

transfer_retention_or_expenditure.description: Set to `true` if the affiliate and beneficiary sell or give away resources to each other.

association_types.description: Describe the relationship between significant beneficiaries and the affiliation.

legal_entities_affiliation.description: Information about a single affiliation of significant beneficiaries.

is_auxiliary_controller.description: Specifies if the additional representative is a auxiliary controller for the legal entity.

is_beneficial_owner.description: Specifies if the additional representative or controller is a beneficial owner for the legal entity.

job_title.description: The job title of the controller.

shared_representative_request.description: Personal details of the additional representative.

shared_traded_exchanges_request.description: Describes all the markets where the company is publicly traded.

holder_name.description: Name of the person as it appears on the credit card or bank account statement.

country_code.description: Country code associated with the legal entity.

phone_number.description: Phone number associated with the legal entity.

x-enumDescriptions.personal: Indicates that the phone number is for a personal device.
x-enumDescriptions.business: Indicates that the phone number is for a business device.

holder-resp.description: Personal details of the person who owns the credit card or the bank account.

bank_name.description: The name of the payout bank.

last_four.description: The last four digits of the payout bank account.

reports_payout_bank.description: Contains details relevant to the payout bank.

bin.description: Bank identification number. The initial six digits of a credit card number. Null is returned if BIN is not available.

card_brand.description: Brand of the credit card. Possible values include: `amex`, `discover`, `diners`, `jcb`, `mastercard`, `visa`.

last_four.description: The last four digits of the credit card number.

bank_name.description: The name of the Payment bank.

last_four.description: The last four numbers of the bank account. **Note:** If you have verified your account via Plaid, this might be the last four numbers of your tokenized bank account number (TAN).

x-enumDescriptions.ACCOUNT_DEBIT_FAILURE: If WePay is unable to collect fees from a merchant at the end of a billing cycle, this fee is applied to the merchant's account.
x-enumDescriptions.ADJUSTMENT: If a merchant is charged incorrect fees, **or** if a merchant is charged correct fees but fees are reported incorrectly, WePay will adjust the merchant's account to correct the issue.
x-enumDescriptions.AMEX: Indicates that the fees are the AmEx card brand processing fees.
x-enumDescriptions.CHARGEBACK: Indicates that the fees are charged for disputes.
x-enumDescriptions.DISCOVER: Indicates that the fees are the Discover / Diners card brand processing fees.
x-enumDescriptions.ECHECK: Indicates fees that are charged for ACH / eCheck transactions.
x-enumDescriptions.JCB: Indicates that the fees are the JCB card brand processing fees.
x-enumDescriptions.MAESTRO: Indicates that the fees are the Maestro card brand processing fees.
x-enumDescriptions.MASTERCARD: Indicates that the fees are the Mastercard card brand processing fees.
x-enumDescriptions.RECURRING FEES: Indicates recurring service fees charged by platforms for offering interchange processing.
x-enumDescriptions.UNIONPAY: Indicates that the fees are the UnionPay card brand processing fees.
x-enumDescriptions.VISA: Indicates that the fees are the Visa card brand processing fees.

standard_id.description: JPMC Standard ID of referring representative

coupon_code.description: This is an offer code provided by Chase to incentivize merchants to sign up for WePay

city.description: City associated with the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

line1.description: First line of the address **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

postal_code.description: Postal code associated with the address.

region.description: Region associated with the address. Expected values are state or province abbreviations for addresses in the US or CA. **Note:** for entity and controller address, the following values are not supported: `PR`, `VI`, `AA`, `AE`, and `AP`.

usd-currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code. Currently, the only supported value is `USD`.

terminals_deferred_authorization.description: Configuration settings for deferred authorization (offline auth) functionality. Enabling `deferred_authoization` means that merchants can still transact with offline terminals, although risk of declines may increase. Once an offline terminal goes online again, the encoded payment method can be used to create a Payment. **Note:** If not sent or if explicitly set to `null` (i.e. `deferred_authorization`: `null`), the deferred authorization parameters will revert to their defaults.

enabled.description: Determines if deferred authorization functionality is enabled.

international_enabled.description: Determines if international payment methods are allowed for deferred authorizations.

max_total_amount.description: The maximum total amount of money that can be processed as deferred authorizations. The amount is in cents. For example, if the value is set to 250000, it represents $2500.00. Once exceeded, the terminal will no longer process transactions until connectivity has been restored.

max_transaction_amount.description: The maximum amount for any single transaction that can be processed as a deferred authorization. The amount is in cents. For example, if the value is set to 12500, it represents $125.00. Attempts to process authorizations above this amount will fail until connectivity has been restored.

max_transaction_count.description: The maximum number of transactions that can be processed as deferred authorizations. Once exceeded, the terminal will no longer process transactions until connectivity has been restored.

supported_card_entry_modes.description: The card entry modes that are allowed in deferred authorizations.

x-enumDescriptions.chip: Include this value to support dipping cards during offline authorizations.
x-enumDescriptions.magnetic_stripe: Include this value to support swiping cards during offline authorizations.
x-enumDescriptions.contactless: Include this value to support tapping cards during offline authorizations.
x-enumDescriptions.manual: Include this value to support manually entering card information during offline authorizations.

avs_prompt_enabled.description: If true, a user is prompted to enter AVS (ZIP code) during manual card entry.

cvd_prompt_enabled.description: If true, a user is prompted to enter CVD (same as CVC) during manual card entry.

terminals_quick_chip.description: Configuration settings for quick chip functionality.

enabled.description: Determines if quick chip functionality is enabled on the terminal.

terminals-supported_card_brands.description: The collection of card brands that are supported by the terminal. Must provide at least one.

mode.description: The way in which tip is handled by this terminal. If "disabled", tip will not be prompted for. Otherwise, value determines if the prompt should appear on the terminal or on the receipt. Note: If set to "prompt_on_terminal" then you must provide the "terminal_display" field as well.

x-enumDescriptions.disabled: No prompt for a tip amount to be added to the authorization will be shown on the terminal or receipt.
x-enumDescriptions.prompt_on_terminal: Users will be prompted to add a tip amount to their authorization on the terminal UI.
x-enumDescriptions.prompt_on_receipt: Users will be prompted to add a tip amount to their authorization on the receipt.

terminal_display.description: This configuration is required if the mode is "prompt_on_terminal", and is responsible for configuring how the tip guide appears on the physical terminal.

amount_guide_type.description: The type of the amount guide can be either a percentage guide or a flat guide. Percentage guides will offer the payer a chance to tip with one of a few default tip percentages that are configured. Flat guides will offer the payer flat tip amounts to choose from. Both types of guides will allow the payer to manually enter a tip amount.

x-enumDescriptions.percentage_guide: Indicate that you'll be providing the percentage tip options for payers to select from on the device.
x-enumDescriptions.flat_guide: Indicate that you'll be providing the flat tip options for payers to select from on the device.

flat_guide.description: The configuration for a flat tip guide. All three guides must be provided. Note that the expected value is the recommended tip amount in cents, and will appear on the device in dollars and cents.

amount_high.description: The highest flat tip amount which will appear on the device for a payer to select. The example provided here would show on the device as $3.00.

amount_low.description: The lowest flat tip amount which will appear on the device for a payer to select. The example provided here would show on the device as $1.00.

amount_medium.description: The middle flat tip amount which will appear on the device for a payer to select. The example provided here would show on the device as $2.00.

percentage_guide.description: The configuration for a percentage tip guide. All three guides must be provided, in addition to the amount display toggle.

percentage_high.description: The highest percentage tip option which will appear on the device for a payer to select.

percentage_low.description: The lowest percentage tip option which will appear on the device for a payer to select.

percentage_medium.description: The middle percentage tip option which will appear on the device for a payer to select.

show_amount.description: Toggle whether or not to show the amount that the percentage equates to in the tip guide button.

date_of_birth_is_present.description: Indicates if the date of birth of the controller is present.

is_auxiliary_controller.description: Specifies if the additional representative is a auxiliary controller for the legal entity.

is_beneficial_owner.description: Specifies if the additional representative or controller is a beneficial owner for the legal entity.

job_title.description: The job title of the controller.

shared_representative_response.description: Personal details of the additional representative.

attest_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the legal entity was attested.

original_ip.description: The user's client IP address when they attested legal entity information.

representative_id.description: The `additional_representatives.representative_{0-3}` identifier of the additional representative that attested the legal entity, if applicable. If the person who provided attestation was **not** an additional representative, then this field will not be returned.

x-enumDescriptions.representative_0: The legal entity is attested by the first additional representative.
x-enumDescriptions.representative_1: The legal entity is attested by the second additional representative.
x-enumDescriptions.representative_2: The legal entity is attested by the third additional representative.
x-enumDescriptions.representative_3: The legal entity is attested by the fourth additional representative.

attest_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the legal entity was attested.

original_ip.description: The user's client IP address when they attested legal entity information.

job_title.description: The job title of the controller.

legal_entities_traded_exchanges_response.description: Describes all the markets where the company is publicly traded.

postal_code.description: Postal code associated with the address.

city.description: City associated with the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

line1.description: First line of the address **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

line2.description: Second line of the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

region.description: Region associated with the address. Expected values are state or province abbreviations for addresses in the US or CA. **Note:** for entity and controller address, the following values are not supported: `PR`, `VI`, `AA`, `AE`, and `AP`.

shared_holder_address_request.description: Address indicating where services were rendered, origin of goods, or account holder for credit card / payment bank.

email_is_verified.description: Mark the email as verified after you have established it is the right email.

shared_account_controller.description: Personal details of the account controller. *Note:* An account controller is an authorized representative who controls the merchant account and can call in for support. The `account_controller` replaces the `controller` object for government entities and publicly traded companies (including subsidiaries).

shared_additional_representatives_reques.description: Personal information for additional representatives of the legal entity. WePay collects additional representatives information for businesses. The additional representatives could a beneficial owners or an auxiliary controller.  This is determined by setting the parameters on the representative. **Note:** You can pass `{}` to signify that this legal entity does not have any additional representatives.

email_is_verified.description: Mark the email as verified after you have established it is the right email.

is_beneficial_owner.description: Specifies if the additional representative or controller is a beneficial owner for the legal entity.

job_title.description: The job title of the controller.

shared_controller_request.description: Personal details of the controller. **Note:** A controller is an individual with significant responsibility to control or manage a legal entity. Examples of controllers include, but are not limited to, a Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Chief Operating Officer, Managing Member, General Partner, President, Vice President, or Treasurer, or any other individual who regularly performs similar functions as part of a control prong.

x-enumDescriptions.controller: Personal details of the controller. **Note:** A controller is an individual with significant responsibility to control or manage a legal entity. Examples of controllers include, but are not limited to, a Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Chief Operating Officer, Managing Member, General Partner, President, Vice President, or Treasurer, or any other individual who regularly performs similar functions as part of a control prong.
x-enumDescriptions.account_controller: Personal details of the account controller. **Note:** An account controller is an authorized representative who controls the account and can call in for support. Account controllers are not subject to the same definition as `controller`.

controller_type.description: Describes the type of controller for an account. Can be either `controller` (standard) or `account_controller` (government entities and publicly traded companied (including subsidiaries)).

custom_data.description: Any custom data your platform chooses to attach to this resource. The custom data must be key-value pairs and not contain any personally identifiable information (PII) or payment card (PCI) data.

entity-email-nullable.description: Email associated with the Legal Entity (business email). Note that each domain label (parts that are separated by dots) must not exceed 63 characters.

is_publicly_traded.description: Specifies if the legal entity is a publicly traded company. Should be `false` for subsidiaries of publicly traded companies.

is_subsidiary.description: Specifies if the legal entity is a subsidiary of a publicly traded company.

parent_company_name.description: Name of the parent company if the company is a subsidiary of a publicly traded company.

primary_exchange.description: Describes the primary market/stock-exchange where the company is publicly traded.

shared_public_ownership_request.description: Information regarding public ownership of an entity. Required for publicly traded companies.

reference_id.description: A custom reference ID for your platform to track the object. It can be any string.

id.description: ID of the token, generated by WePay when the token is created.

permissioned_fields.description: Array of JSON dot-notated paths for allowed fields. You can add any string as a value but only values which correspond to an existing field will be utilized.

shared_token_request.description: A previously created token. **Note:** Using tokens to pass highly-sensitive data directly to WePay may help your platform avoid certain compliance and regulatory overhead. Learn more about tokens [here](/sdks-and-libraries/helper-js/#tokenization).

resource-payment_methods.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

id.description: The application ID assigned to your platform in the Partner Center. Your app owns the payment methods that you create, allowing them be used across any of your merchants.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

resource.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

shared_payment_method_owner_response.description: Details the owner resource and owner path.

x-enumDescriptions.legal_entities: rBits associated with a Legal Entity.
x-enumDescriptions.payout_methods: rBits associated with a Payout Method.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_methods: rBits associated with a Payment Method.

resource_types-rbit.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

id.description: ID of the payout method, generated by WePay when the payout method is created.

x-enumDescriptions.payout_bank_gb: Bank account in the UK (not currently supported).
x-enumDescriptions.paper_check: Paper check delivered to an address in the US.

type.description: Possible values: `payout_bank_ca`, `payout_bank_us` and `payout_bank_gb`. **Note:** The `paper_check` option requires permission from WePay to use. Reach out to your integration team for assistance.

reports_payout_method.description: Contains details relevant to the payout method.

id.description: ID of the payment method, generated by WePay when the payment method is created.

x-enumDescriptions.credit_card: This value is required if the `credit_card` structure is being sent with raw credit card data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_us: This value is required if the `payment_bank_us` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.

payment_bank_ca.description: This value is required if the `payment_bank_ca` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.

type.description: The type of payment method. Possible values include: `payment_bank_us`, and `credit_card`.

reports_payment_method.description: Contains details relevant to the payment method.

item_count.description: The number of transactions the merchant processed in a transactions summary for the given fee type.

total_amount.description: Gross transaction amount a merchant has processed in a transactions summary for the given fee type. This is a sum of (the merchant's net settlement) + (total fees).

product_name.description: Product name associated with the order.

product_code.description: Product code associated with the order.

item-nullable-req.description: Item object with detailed information. Can be expandable.

x-enumDescriptions.manual_capture: The payment was created with `auto_capture` set to `false`. Identify why the payment was created with a pending capture value, and evaluate if the payment is ready for capture.
x-enumDescriptions.processing: ACH payment can remain in a pending state due to processing for up to 2 business days. If the payment method was not a bank account and the status gets stuck in pending, reach out to WePay for support.
x-enumDescriptions.risk_review: The payment is pending while WePay reviews it. Once WePay's review is complete, the status will update to either `completed` or `failed`.
x-enumDescriptions.echeck_submission: The payment is pending a response from the processing institution.
x-enumDescriptions.bank_verification: The payment is pending while the payer verifies microdeposits. If the payer is able to verify their payment method, then the payment status will update to `completed`. If not, then the payment status will update to `failed`.
x-enumDescriptions.deferred_capture: The payment was created with a value for `capture_at`. The payment will capture at the time designated by the UNIX timestamp, or you can update the payment with a different `capture_at` time.
x-enumDescriptions.unknown: The payment is pending due to unknown reasons. Reach out to WePay for support.

x-enumDescriptions.PENDING_CAPTURE: The payment is pending a manual capture. Identify why the payment was created with a pending capture value, and evaluate if the payment is ready for capture.
x-enumDescriptions.PROCESSING: The payment currently under processing. Allow ACH payments up to 2 business days to process, otherwise reach out to WePay Support.
x-enumDescriptions.REVIEW: The payment is currently pending risk review. Allow the WePay team until 5pm the next business day from the payment entering review.
x-enumDescriptions.ECHECK_SUBMISSION: The payment is pending a response from the processing institution. Allow 2 business days to process, otherwise reach out to WePay Support.
x-enumDescriptions.BANK_VERIFICATION: The payment is currently pending payment bank verification. If the Plaid lightbox was not used, remind the payer to look for microdeposits and to verify them with your platform. Once the payer has verified the microdeposits, send the POST /payment_methods/{id}/verify_bank_deposits request.
x-enumDescriptions.UNKNOWN: The payment is pending due to unknown reasons. Reach out to WePay Support.

x-enumDescriptions.risk_review: The payout has started processing, but requires WePay to review it before proceeding.
x-enumDescriptions.processing: The payout has started processing and the status will update shortly.

x-enumDescriptions.REVIEW: The payout has started processing, but requires WePay to review it before proceeding.
x-enumDescriptions.PROCESSING: The payout has started processing and the status will update shortly.

payouts_pending_reasons_response.description: Explains why this payout is pending and may contain an array of reasons.

x-enumDescriptions.processing: The recovery attempt is processing. Since recoveries are a form of ACH transaction, please allow 2 business days for the status to update.
x-enumDescriptions.unknown: The recovery attempt is processing, but for unknown reasons. Reach out to WePay if the status takes more than 2 business days to update.

x-enumDescriptions.PROCESSING: The recovery attempt is processing. Since recoveries are a form of ACH transaction, please allow 2 business days for the status to update.
x-enumDescriptions.UNKNOWN: The recovery attempt is processing, but for unknown reasons. Reach out to WePay if the status takes more than 2 business days to update.

x-enumDescriptions.risk_review: The refund has started processing, but requires WePay to review it before proceeding. Allow the WePay team until 5pm the next business day from the refund entering review.
x-enumDescriptions.processing: The refund has started processing and the status will update shortly.
x-enumDescriptions.unknown: The refund is pending due to unknown reasons. Please reach out to WePay for further information.

x-enumDescriptions.REVIEW: The refund has started processing, but requires WePay to review it before proceeding. Allow the WePay team until 5pm the next business day from the refund entering review.
x-enumDescriptions.PROCESSING: The refund has started processing and the status will update shortly.
x-enumDescriptions.UNKNOWN: The refund is pending due to unknown reasons. Please reach out to WePay for further information.

payout_method_id.description: ID of the payout method associated with the USD payout.

x-enumDescriptions.daily: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every day. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.weekly: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every week on Monday. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.monthly: WePay will send the value of an Account's available balance to the linked Payout Method every month on the 1st, and the available balance will then become $0. If an Account's available balance is already $0, then no Payout will be sent.

period.description: Describes the how often a USD payout will occur.

pricing_by_currency-create-CAD.description: The Merchant IC+ pricing model is not currently supported for merchants based in Canada.

fixed_fee_markup_amount.description: Define a fixed dollar amount to charge per transaction. This integer value describes the fee in cents, so a value of `2` describes $0.02.

variable_fee_markup_bps.description: Basis points to calculate variable markup fee amount. Basis points translate directly to percent, so a value of `20` here will be calculated as 0.2%, this percentage is charged per transaction.

transaction.description: Describe fixed and variable fees to charge merchants per transaction.

fixed_fee_markup_amount.description: Set a fixed amount to charge merchants per credit card authorization attempt, regardless of down-stream approval or decline. This integer value describes the fee in cents, so a value of `2` describes $0.02.

auth.description: Describe fixed fees to charge merchants per authorization, regardless of success or decline.

chargeback_amount.description: A fixed amount to charge the merchant per credit card chargeback they receive, defined by the Partner.

refund_fee_for_transaction_markup.description: Flag to charge Merchant IC+ merchants for refund. If set to true, merchants are charged the fixed markup (the value of `transaction.fixed_fee_markup_amount`) of the original transaction per refund.

interchange_plus.description: The interchange plus pricing model for credit cards to collect platform markup fees.

max_fee_amount.description: The maximum value of total fee amount.

min_fee_amount.description: The minimum value of total fee amount.

variable_fee_bps.description: The basis points to calculate variable fee amount.

refund_fee_for_standard.description: Flag to charge Merchant IC+ merchants refunds against ACH/eCheck transactions. If set to `true`, merchants are charged the `fixed_fee_amount` of the original transaction per refund.

standard.description: The standard pricing model to collect platform fees when the payment method is a payment bank.

amount.description: Describe the amount of fees to be charged at each interval.

period.description: Describe the interval as which recurring fees should be charged.

recurring_fee.description: Describe any regularly recurring fees charged to the merchant by your platform. These are typically fees charged for services rendered by your platform. **This fee is only to be charged while the merchant is active on your platform. You must provide merchants a method to close their account and stop incurring this fee.**

path.description: The HTTP path of the resource. The path can be used to retrieve details about the resource and perform actions on it.

x-enumDescriptions.USD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in US dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.CAD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Canadian dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.GBP: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Great British pounds. **Note:** Not currently supported.

currencies.description: [Merchant IC+ pricing](/pricing/merchant-interchange-plus/) is available exclusively for merchants with a `USD` Account or Blended pricing model.

pricing-resp.description: The [Merchant IC+ pricing model](/pricing/merchant-interchange-plus/#define-merchant-ic-pricing) and Blended pricing model to collect platform payment fees from the merchant. Your markup fees should be inclusive of WePay processing fees, which will be debited from your platform Account. For any markup that you define, you'll receive that amount less WePay fees. If you choose to have a lower markup than the fees WePay charges, your Account will be debited to cover the difference.

pricing_by_currency-update-CAD.description: The Merchant IC+ pricing model is not currently supported for merchants based in Canada.

operates_in_sanctioned_countries.description: An array of sanctioned countries where the Legal Entity operates. Possible values include `CU`, `IR`, `KP`, `XX`, `SY`. Note that `XX` is used to represent Crimea, as it does not have its own 2-digit ISO code. If the merchant indicates they do not have operations in one of the sanctioned countries listed above, then pass an empty array: `[]`. This field is required, if the value is left `null`, capabilities (payments and payouts) will be disabled.

entity_name.description: The name of the legal entity. This should **not** contain a merchant's DBA; DBAs can be included on the Account resource. Must not contain the word `wepay`.

acceptance_time.description: Time (in UNIX) when WePay's Terms of Service was accepted.

original_ip.description: The IP address in use when WePay's Terms of Service was accepted.

terms_of_service_version.description: The version of WePay's Terms of Service that was accepted.

auto_update.description: Automatically update credit cards that have been stored with WePay. If a card is expired, or has been replaced (e.g., due to theft), it will be automatically updated based in information provided by card networks. To receive these updates, be sure to [subscribe](/api/latest/operation/POST_notification_preferences/) to the `payment_methods.updated` notification event topic.

bin.description: Bank identification number. The initial six digits of a credit card number. Null is returned if BIN is not available.

card_brand.description: Brand of the credit card. Possible values include: `amex`, `discover`, `diners`, `jcb`, `mastercard`, `visa`.
