x-enumDescriptions.savings: If the payer's bank account is a savings account, they must select this option in order to successfully verify their payment method.

last_four.description: The last four numbers of the bank account. **Note:** If you have verified your account via Plaid, this might be the last four numbers of your tokenized bank account number (TAN).

x-enumDescriptions.unverified: This payment method has not been verified yet and cannot be used to create payments until the status updates to `verified`.
x-enumDescriptions.verified: This payment method has successfully been verified and can now be used to create payments.
x-enumDescriptions.verification_failed: Verification attempt(s) for this payment method have failed. If this value returns, the payer should double check their payment details and re-submit them.
x-enumDescriptions.deleted: This payment method has been permanently deleted and cannot be used to create any further payments.

type.description: Type of payment method. Possible values include: `credit_card`, `payment_bank_us`, `payment_method_id`, `encoded_payment_method`.

x-enumDescriptions.credit_card: This value is required if the `credit_card` structure is being sent with raw credit card data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_us: This value is required if the `payment_bank_us` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_ca: This value is required if the `payment_bank_ca` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.
x-enumDescriptions.encoded_payment_method: This value is required if the `encoded_payment_method` structure is being sent with the payment blob from the Card Present SDK.
x-enumDescriptions.google_pay: This value is required if the `google_pay` structure is being sent with google pay data.

resource-payments.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

x-enumDescriptions.invalid_address: The address could not be verified. Advise that the payer double check their billing address or to check with their card issuer.
x-enumDescriptions.invalid_card_number: The card number is invalid. Advise that the payer verify their card details or use a different card.
x-enumDescriptions.invalid_card_type: The card type is invalid. Identify the cards accepted by the WePay account in question, and advise that the payer use a different card of that type.
x-enumDescriptions.card_not_supported: The card type does not support this purchase. Some card brands have restrictions on the types of purchases. Advise that the payer use a different payment method.
x-enumDescriptions.incorrect_cid: The CVC number is incorrect. Advise the payer to verify their card details or use a different card.
x-enumDescriptions.decline_insufficient_funds: The card has insufficient funds for this transaction. Advise that the payer try the payment when they have sufficient funds, or that they use a different payment method.
x-enumDescriptions.decline_card_stolen: The card cannot be used for this transaction (it may have been reported stolen). Do not relay the possible "reported stolen" status to the payer. Advise that the payer check with their card issuer.
x-enumDescriptions.decline_card_inactive: The card cannot be used for this transaction (it may have been reported inactive). Do not relay the possible "reported inactive" status to the payer. Advise that the payer check with their card issuer.
x-enumDescriptions.decline_credit_limit: The card has reached its balance or credit limit available. Advise that the payer use a card with an available balance or credit limit.
x-enumDescriptions.decline_general: The card has been declined for unknown reasons. Advise that the payer check with their card issuer.
x-enumDescriptions.card_expired: The card has expired. Advise that the payer resubmit their card details with the most current expiration date and to try the payment again.
x-enumDescriptions.card_invalid_data: One or more fields associated with this transaction has invalid data. Advise that the payer check their card details or use a different payment method.
x-enumDescriptions.card_missing_fields: The card data is missing required fields. Check your platform's UI to ensure that you are collecting all fields required by WePay up front. Advise the payer on what the required fields are and that they resubmit card details.
x-enumDescriptions.system_failure: Issuer or host system could not be reached. Advise that the payer wait a few minutes and to try again. If the issue persists, check the [WePay status page](https://status.wepay.com/) or reach out to WePay's API Support (api@wepay.com).
x-enumDescriptions.excessive_authorizations: The card has exceeded its withdrawal limit. Advise that the payer check with their card issuer or try a different payment method.
x-enumDescriptions.account_cannot_transact: The card or the account its connected to cannot transact. Verify the `status` of the Payment Method, and the `status` and `capabilities` of the receiving Account in order to identify the issue.
x-enumDescriptions.bank_failure: The bank declined this transaction for unknown reasons. Advise that the payer check with their connected bank or to add a new payment method.
x-enumDescriptions.no_payment_attempted: Payment could not be captured for unknown reasons. Advise that the payer double check their card details and to re-submit after a few minutes. If the issue persists, check the [WePay status page](https://status.wepay.com/) or reach out to WePay's API Support (api@wepay.com).
x-enumDescriptions.failed_permanently: Payment could not be captured for unknown reasons. Advise that the payer double check their card details and to re-submit after a few minutes. If the issue persists, check the [WePay status page](https://status.wepay.com/) or reach out to WePay's API Support (api@wepay.com).
x-enumDescriptions.unexpected: Payment could not be captured for unknown reasons. Advise that the payer double check their card details and to re-submit after a few minutes. If the issue persists, check the [WePay status page](https://status.wepay.com/) or reach out to WePay's API Support (api@wepay.com).
x-enumDescriptions.undefined: Payment could not be captured for unknown reasons. Advise that the payer double check their card details and to re-submit after a few minutes. If the issue persists, check the [WePay status page](https://status.wepay.com/) or reach out to WePay's API Support (api@wepay.com).
x-enumDescriptions.debit_card_not_accepted: Debit card is not accepted for this transaction. Advise that the payer add a credit card or ACH payment method and re-try the payment.
x-enumDescriptions.exceeded_token_amount_limit: This transaction exceeds the token amount limit. Identify why your platform is requesting a payment for more than the authorized amount of the token. Advise that the payer resubmit their payment method and try the payment again once the token has the correct amount limit.
x-enumDescriptions.token_currency_mismatch: This transaction does not match the currency specified in the token. Identify why your platform is requesting a payment in a different currency than the token. Re-send the POST /payments call once the correct currency is in place.
x-enumDescriptions.processor_timed_out: The processor was unavailable so we could not capture the payment. Advise that the payer wait a few minutes before resubmitting the payment. If the issue persists, check the [WePay status page](https://status.wepay.com/) or reach out to WePay's API Support (api@wepay.com).
x-enumDescriptions.processor_declined: The payment was declined by processor for unknown reasons. Advise that the payer check with their card issuer or try a different payment method.
x-enumDescriptions.R01: ACH reason: Insufficient funds in account. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R02: ACH reason: Account is closed. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R03: ACH reason: No account on file. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R04: ACH reason: Invalid account number. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R05: ACH reason: Unauthorized debit to consumer account. Bank rejected payment request, no follow-up suggested
x-enumDescriptions.R06: AH reason: Returned at request of originating bank. Advise that they payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R07: ACH reason: Authorization revoked by customer. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R08: ACH reason: Payment stopped. The payer stopped this request for payment. Please work with the payer for updated payment information.
x-enumDescriptions.R09: ACH reason: Insufficient collected funds in account being charged. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R10: ACH reason: Customer Advises Originator is Not Known to Receiver and/or Is Not Authorized by Receiver to Debit Receiver’s Account. Advise that the merchant work with the payer to resolve the matter.
x-enumDescriptions.R11: ACH reason: Customer Advises Entry Not In Accordance with the Terms of the Authorization. Advise that the merchant work with the payer to resolve the matter.
x-enumDescriptions.R12: ACH reason: Account sold to another financial institution. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R13: ACH reason: Invalid ACH routing number. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R14: ACH reason: Payee is deceased. Bank rejected payment request, no follow-up suggested.
x-enumDescriptions.R15: ACH reason: Account holder is deceased. Bank rejected payment request, no follow-up suggested.
x-enumDescriptions.R16: ACH reason: Account funds have been frozen. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R17: ACH reason: Item returned because of invalid data. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R18: ACH reason: Improper effective entry date. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R19: ACH reason: Amount error. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R20: ACH reason: Account does not allow ACH transactions or limit has been exceeded. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R21: ACH reason: Invalid company identification. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R22: ACH reason: Invalid individual ID. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank
x-enumDescriptions.R23: ACH reason: Credit entry refused by receiver. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R24: ACH reason: Duplicate entry. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R25: ACH reason: Addenda record error. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R26: ACH reason: Mandatory field error. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R27: ACH reason: Trace number error. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R28: ACH reason: Routing / transit number check digit error. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R29: ACH reason: Corporate customer advised not authorized. Bank rejected payment request, no follow-up suggested.
x-enumDescriptions.R30: ACH reason: RDFI not participant in check truncation program. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R31: ACH reason: Permissible return entry. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R32: ACH reason: Receiving bank non-settlement. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account
x-enumDescriptions.R33: ACH reason: Return of item. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R34: ACH reason: Limited participation originating bank. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R35: ACH reason: Return of improper debit entry. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R36: ACH reason: Return of improper credit entry. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R37: ACH reason: Source document presented for payment. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R38: ACH reason: Stop payment on source document. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R39: ACH reason: Improper source document. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R40: ACH reason: Return of item by government agency. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R41: ACH reason: Invalid Transaction Code. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R42: ACH reason: Routing / transit number check digit error. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R43: ACH reason: Invalid account number. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R44: ACH reason: Invalid individual ID. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R45: ACH reason: Invalid individual or company name. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R46: ACH reason: Invalid payee indicator code. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R47: ACH reason: Duplicate enrollment. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R50: ACH reason: State law affecting RCK acceptance. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R51: ACH reason: Item is ineligible, notice not provided, signature not genuine, or original item altered for adjustment entry. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R52: ACH reason: Stop payment on item. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R53: ACH reason: Item and ACH entry presented for payment. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R61: ACH reason: Misrouted return - RDFI has placed incorrect routing/transit # in RDFI id field. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R67: ACH reason: Duplicate return. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R68: ACH reason: Untimely return - the return was not sent within the established timeframe. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R69: ACH reason: Field errors. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R70: ACH reason: Permissible return entry not accepted. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R71: ACH reason: Misrouted dishonored return - incorrect routing/transit # in RDFI id field. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R72: ACH reason: Untimely return - dishonored return was not sent within the established timeframe. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R73: ACH reason: Timely original return - RDFI certifies the original return entry was sent within established timeframe for original returns. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R74: ACH reason: Corrected return - RDFI is correcting a previous return entry that was dishonored because it contained incomplete or incorrect information. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R75: ACH reason: Original return not a duplicate. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R76: ACH reason: No errors found. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R80: ACH reason: Cross-border payment coding error. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R81: ACH reason: Non-participant in cross-border program. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R82: ACH reason: Invalid foreign RDFI identification. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R83: ACH reason: Foreign RDFI unable to settle. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R84: ACH reason: Cross-border entry not processed by originating gateway operator. Advise that the payer resubmit payment with updated account information or a new account.
x-enumDescriptions.R94: ACH reason: Administrative return item was processed and resubmitted as a photocopy. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R95: ACH reason: Administrative return item was processed and resubmitted as a MICR-Split. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R97: ACH reason: Administrative return item was processed and resubmitted with corrected dollar amount. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R98: ACH reason: Indicates a return PAC (pre-authorized check); RDFI provides a text reason and indicated a new account number on the PAC itself. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.R99: ACH reason: Indicates a return PAC (pre-authorized check); RDFI provides a text reason on the PAC itself for which there is no equivalent return reason code. Advise that the payer use a different bank account, preferably at a different bank.
x-enumDescriptions.request_expired: The payment request has expired. Please refer to Payments documentation for details on when payment request expires. Verify whether the payment was supposed to go through with the merchant and payer. If the payment was supposed to be captured, re-try the payment and be sure to capture it within the 7 day timeframe.
x-enumDescriptions.risk_review: The payment could not be captured as it failed risk review. No action recommended. Let the merchant know that the payer will need to find an alternate method of payment.
x-enumDescriptions.unknown: The payment could not be captured for unknown reasons. Reach out to WePay Support for assistance.
x-enumDescriptions.other: The payment could have been rejected for a variety of reasons. Please contact support.

x-enumDescriptions.NOT_CAPTURED: Failed to capture the payment. See the `detail_code` for further information.
x-enumDescriptions.ECHECK_FRAUD: Failed to process an ACH payment due to reported fraudulent activity on the bank account. See the `detail_code` for further information.
x-enumDescriptions.BANK_NOT_CONFIRMED: Failed to process an ACH payment due to incorrect bank account information. See the `detail_code` for further information.
x-enumDescriptions.BANK_SYSTEM_ERROR: Failed to process an ACH payment due to an error. See the `detail_code` for additional information.
x-enumDescriptions.PAYMENT_EXPIRED: Payments generally need to be captured within 7 days from the authorization, otherwise the auth will expire and this error will return. See `detail_code` for further information.
x-enumDescriptions.REVIEW: WePay's review of a payment resulted in a decline from WePay's end. No action recommended. Let the merchant know that the payer will need to find an alternate method of payment.
x-enumDescriptions.UNKNOWN: Failed to capture the payment due to unknown reasons. Reach out to WePay Support for assistance.

id.description: The resource ID of the order generated when your app created it on a [POST /orders](/api/#/http/api-endpoints/risk/create-an-order) request.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

shared_order_response.description: The resource ID and path for the Order that your app created and associated with the payment.

id.description: The app ID assigned to your platform in the Partner Center.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

txnr_app_fee.description: Fetch this transaction record to account for the portion of this transaction which impact your application balance.

x-enumDescriptions.suspected_payer_fraud: **Do not provide this information to end-users.** The payout failed due to potential fraud from a payer on the account.
x-enumDescriptions.suspected_merchant_fraud: **Do not provide this information to end-users.** The payout failed due to potential fraud from the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.account_compromised: The payout failed due to unauthorized user(s) accessing the merchant's account.
x-enumDescriptions.unable_to_verify_controlling_owner: WePay needs additional information about the legal entity's controller before allowing payouts to process. Find more information on the legal entity verifications resource.

x-enumDescriptions.SUSPECTED_FRAUD: **Do not provide this information to end-users.** The payout failed due to potential fraud.
x-enumDescriptions.VERIFICATION: WePay needs additional information before allowing payouts to process.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

txnr_failure.description: When a non-payment resource (i.e. recoveries or payouts) fails to process, fetch this transaction record in order to maintain accurate accounting of the merchant's balance.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

txnr_payout.description: When a payout has occurred, fetch this transaction record to account for the debit from the merchant.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

payout_methods_owner_response.description: Details the owner resource and owner path.

rbit_id.description: ID of the rbit, generated by WePay when the rbit is created.

resource-rbits.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

x-enumDescriptions.insufficient_funds: The recovery failed; the bank rejected the attempt due to insufficient funds in the bank account.
x-enumDescriptions.unknown: The recovery attempt failed due to unknown reasons. Reach out to WePay for further information.

x-enumDescriptions.BANK_REJECT: The issuing bank denied WePay's attempt to debit the bank account.
x-enumDescriptions.UNKNOWN: The recovery attempt failed for an unknown reason.

id.description: The app ID assigned to your platform in the Partner Center.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

txnr_recovery.description: When a recovery occurs, fetch this transaction record to account for the debit from the merchant's account balance.

fee_refund_amount.description: The amount of the refund coming from the fees.

total_amount.description: The total amount for the refund including the fees.

refunds_amounts.description: The amount of the refund when not performing a full refund.

x-enumDescriptions.risk_review: The refund was failed by WePay. Please reach out for additional information.
x-enumDescriptions.unknown: The refund failed due to unknown reasons. Please reach out to WePay for further information.

x-enumDescriptions.REVIEW: The refund was failed by WePay. Please reach out for additional information.
x-enumDescriptions.UNKNOWN: The refund failed due to unknown reasons. Please reach out to WePay for further information.

adjustment_id.description: ID of the adjustment, generated by WePay when the adjustment is created.

amount.description: Amount of the adjustment.

payout_id.description: ID of the payout, generated by WePay when the payout is created.

reference_id.description: A custom reference ID for your platform to track the object. It can be any string.

x-enumDescriptions.pending: WePay has started processing the transaction, but it is not yet available.
x-enumDescriptions.completed: WePay has finished processing this transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.refunded: The transaction has been processed and the amount has been refunded.
x-enumDescriptions.disputed: The amount was paid, but the transaction has since received a chargeback.
x-enumDescriptions.failed: WePay could not process the transaction.

status.description: Status of the adjustment. Possible values include: `pending`, `completed`, `refunded`, `disputed`,`failed`,`canceled`.

reports_adjustment.description: Contains details relevant to the adjustment.

amount.description: The amount under dispute. If the dispute amount differs from the transaction amount, there is either [a partial dispute or an exchange rate fluctuation](/payments-101/disputes-deep-dive/#differing-dispute-and-transaction-amounts).

dispute_id.description: ID of the dispute, generated by WePay when the dispute is created.

fee_amount.description: The chargeback fee deducted from merchant account.

payout_id.description: ID of the payout, generated by WePay when the payout is created.

reference_id.description: A custom reference ID for your platform to track the object. It can be any string.

x-enumDescriptions.pending: WePay has started processing the transaction, but it is not yet available.
x-enumDescriptions.completed: WePay has finished processing this transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.refunded: The transaction has been processed and the amount has been refunded.
x-enumDescriptions.disputed: The amount was paid, but the transaction has since received a chargeback.
x-enumDescriptions.failed: WePay could not process the transaction.

status.description: The status of the chargeback reversal.

reports_chargeback_reversal.description: Contains details relevant to the chargeback reversal.

amount.description: The amount under dispute. If the dispute amount differs from the transaction amount, there is either [a partial dispute or an exchange rate fluctuation](/payments-101/disputes-deep-dive/#differing-dispute-and-transaction-amounts).

dispute_id.description: ID of the dispute, generated by WePay when the dispute is created.

fee_amount.description: The dispute fee deducted from merchant account.

payment_id.description: ID of the payment, generated by WePay when the payment is created.

payout_id.description: ID of the payout, generated by WePay when the payout is created.

reference_id.description: A custom reference ID for your platform to track the object. It can be any string.

status.description: Status of the dispute. Possible values include: `awaiting_payee_response`, `awaiting_chargeback_decision`, `pending_wepay_review`, `resolved`,`awaiting_chargeback_decision_with_credit`,'awaiting_chargeback_decision_without_credit'.

x-enumDescriptions.awaiting_merchant_response: The merchant has not provided any response to the dispute. If the merchant want to attempt to recoup these funds, they must upload documentation supporting the charge.
x-enumDescriptions.pending_wepay_review: WePay is reviewing the dispute and any documentation submitted by the merchant. Once WePay's review is complete, the status will be updated.
x-enumDescriptions.awaiting_chargeback_decision: The card issuer is reviewing the dispute and all related evidence and documentation. Once the card issuer's review is complete, the status will be updated.
x-enumDescriptions.resolved: The dispute has been resolved. Find more information in the resolution JSON block.
x-enumDescriptions.awaiting_chargeback_decision_with_credit: The card issuer is reviewing the dispute and all related evidence and documentation. Until a final decision is made, the merchant has a credit for the amount of the dispute and fees. Note that if the dispute is ultimately resolved in favor of the payer, this credit will be reversed and debited from the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.awaiting_chargeback_decision_without_cre: The card issuer is reviewing the dispute and all related evidence and documentation. The merchant will not receive a credit for the dispute while this process takes place. If the dispute is resolved in favor of the merchant, then the merchant will receive the funds back.

reports_dispute.description: Contains details relevant to the dispute.

amount.description: Amount in the lowest denomination.

app_fee_amount.description: The application fee amount for the payment.

net_amount.description: The net amount for the payment.

payment_id.description: ID of the payment, generated by WePay when the payment is created.

payout_id.description: ID of the payout, generated by WePay when the payout is created.

processing_fee_amount.description: The processing fee amount for the payment.

reference_id.description: A custom reference ID for your platform to track the object. It can be any string.

x-enumDescriptions.pending: This payment is processing, but is not yet included in the account's available or reserve balance. Find more information in the `pending_reasons` structure.
x-enumDescriptions.completed: This payment has finished processing, and is now available in either the account's available or reserved balance. **Note:** A payment can have a completed status and simultaneously have a refund or dispute issued against it.
x-enumDescriptions.failed: This payment has failed to process, and cannot be made available to the merchant. Find more information in the `failure_reason` structure.
x-enumDescriptions.canceled: This payment was canceled. If the cancellation was inadvertent, a new payment will need to be created.

status.description: Status of the payment. Possible values include: `canceled` `completed`, `failed`, `pending`.

reports_payment.description: Contains details relevant to the payment.

amount.description: Amount in cents.

payout_id.description: ID of the payout, generated by WePay when the payout is created.

reference_id.description: A custom reference ID for your platform to track the object. It can be any string.

x-enumDescriptions.pending: WePay is currently processing this payout. See the `pending_reasons` structure for additional information.
x-enumDescriptions.completed: WePay has finished processing this payout. **Note:** Other bank institutions must also process payouts to bank accounts before the merchant will see the deposit in their account.
x-enumDescriptions.failed: WePay failed to process this payout. See the `failure_reason` structure for additional information.

reports_payout.description: Contains details relevant to the payout.

amount.description: Amount in cents.

payout_id.description: ID of the payout, generated by WePay when the payout is created.

reference_id.description: A custom reference ID for your platform to track the object. It can be any string.

x-enumDescriptions.pending: WePay has started processing the transaction, but it is not yet available.
x-enumDescriptions.completed: WePay has finished processing this transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.refunded: The transaction has been processed and the amount has been refunded.
x-enumDescriptions.disputed: The amount was paid, but the transaction has since received a chargeback.
x-enumDescriptions.failed: WePay could not process the transaction.

status.description: The status of the payout return.

reports_payout_return.description: Contains details relevant to the payout return.

amount.description: Amount of the recovery.

payout_id.description: ID of the payout, generated by WePay when the payout is created.

recovery_id.description: ID of the recovery, generated by WePay when the recovery is created.

reference_id.description: A custom reference ID for your platform to track the object. It can be any string.

x-enumDescriptions.pending: WePay has started processing the recovery, but it is not yet available. Find more details in the `pending_reasons` structure.
x-enumDescriptions.completed: WePay has processed the recovery. Note that a recovery's status can change from `completed` to `failed` if the issuing bank rejects the debit.
x-enumDescriptions.failed: WePay could not process the recovery. Find more information in the `failure_reason` structure.

status.description: Status of the recovery. Possible values include: `completed`, `failed`, `pending`.

reports_recovery.description: Contains details relevant to the recovery.

amount.description: The total amount for the refund including the fees.

fee_refund_amount.description: The amount of the refund coming from the fees.

payment_id.description: ID of the payment, generated by WePay when the payment is created.

payout_id.description: ID of the payout, generated by WePay when the payout is created.

reference_id.description: A custom reference ID for your platform to track the object. It can be any string.

refund_id.description: ID of the refund, generated by WePay when the refund is created.

status.description: Status of the refund. Possible values include: `pending`, `completed`, `failed`.

reports_refund.description: Contains details relevant to the refund issued.

path-nullable.description: The HTTP path of the resource. The path can be used to retrieve details about the resource and perform actions on it.

resource-session_tokens.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

resource-terminals.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

balances.description: Displays balances pertaining to the merchant account.

description.description: Short description of the merchant account.

x-enumDescriptions.invoice: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is an invoice presented to the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.tracking: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is for general tracking purposes
x-enumDescriptions.drivers_license: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the driver's license presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.passport: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the passport presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.evidence_of_corporate_registration: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the evidence of corporate registration presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.evidence_of_authority: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the evidence of authority presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_bank_statement: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current bank statement presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.evidence_of_nonprofit_registration: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the evidence of non profit registration presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.social_security_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the social security card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_utility_bill: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current utility bill presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.other_government_issued_photo_id: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is other government issued photo id presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_lease_contract: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current lease contract presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.birth_certificate: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the birth certificate presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.not_applicable: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is not applicable.
x-enumDescriptions.certificate_of_citizenship: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the certificate of citizenship presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.permanent_resident_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the permanent resident card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.employment_authorization_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the employment authorization card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.benefits_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the benefits card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.social_insurance_number_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the social insurance number card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.miscellaneous_compliance_doc: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the miscellaneous compliance document presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.business_report: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the business report presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.negative_media_searches: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the negative media searches presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.person_report: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the person report presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.mortgage_statement: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the mortgage statement presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.certified_copy_of_court_order: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the certified copy of the court order presented by the merchant.
