documents.description: An array of documents attached to this merchant to verify fee disclosure.

category_detail.description: Details about the merchant's industry category.

merchant_category_code.description: Category code associated with the merchant's industry.

industry.description: Categorizes the type of service or item a merchant is providing.

name.description: Name of the merchant account; use the "Doing Business As" title for the merchant. Must not contain the word `wepay`. **Note:** Account names can include any regex word character.

platform_onboarding_time.description: The Unix epoch time (in seconds) when the account finished onboarding to the platform.

statement_description.description: A non-empty, ASCII-printable string that does **not** contain the word WePay. This will appear on payers' credit card statements. **Note:** The API allows up to 255 characters, but card issuers will only print 12-14 characters on statements. Find more information [here](/clear/onboard-merchants/).

accepted_method_of_payments.description: Provide the merchant's identifiers with different card brands they accept as methods of payment.

convenience_fee_amount.description: Describe the [convenience fees](/clear/certify/card-network-rules/#convenience-fees) for [Merchant IC+](/pricing/merchant-interchange-plus/) accounts in cents.

enhanced_review.description: Indicates if the account is under enhanced review by WePay.

city.description: City associated with the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

line1.description: First line of the address **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

postal_code.description: Postal code associated with the address.

region.description: Region associated with the address. Expected values are state or province abbreviations for addresses in the US or CA. **Note:** for entity and controller address, the following values are not supported: `PR`, `VI`, `AA`, `AE`, and `AP`.

line2.description: Second line of the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

onboarding_location.description: Address of the legal entity, controller, or additional representatives. When representing the entity's address, send the entity's address of operation. When representing the controller or additional representative send the individual's residential address.

projected_monthly_transaction_volume.description: The projected monthly transaction volume, TPV, of an account.

referral_partner.description: The non ISV partner/solution that refers merchants for payment processing services

x-enumDescriptions.internet: The merchant will process card-not-present web transactions.
x-enumDescriptions.retail: The merchant will process card-present transactions.

amount.description: Amount of the adjustment.

create_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the adjustment was created.

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code. Possible values include: `CAD`, `GBP`, `USD`.

id.description: ID of the adjustment, generated by WePay when the adjustment is created.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

detail_message.description: Adjustment detail message for manual adjustment

x-enumDescriptions.CHARGEBACK: Indicates that the adjustment is a result of a Dispute.
x-enumDescriptions.ESCHEATMENT: Indicates that the adjustment is a result of an abandoned account, which required under law that funds be escheated to the merchant's state (if provided).
x-enumDescriptions.REIMBURSEMENTS_AND_CORRECTIONS: Indicates that the adjustment is a result of funds owed the merchant due to miscalculations or other losses.
x-enumDescriptions.MISCELLANEOUS: Indicates that the adjustment is the result of some other reason not elsewhere described.

reason_code.description: Adjustment reason category. Possible values include: `manual`, `escheatment`.

reason_message.description: An explanation of the reason code.

reason.description: Reasons for and details about the Adjustment.

x-enumDescriptions.credit: Indicates that the adjustment credited the given account with the given amount.
x-enumDescriptions.debit: Indicated that the adjustment debited the given account for the given amount.

type.description: Types of adjustments. Possible values include: `credit`, `debit`.

description.description: Description for an embedded banking application

resource.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type as `banking_application`.

month.description: Indicates the month for which the billing statement is calculated.

resource.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

total_fee_amount.description: The total amount in fees that the merchant owes to the platform.

year.description: Indicates the year in which the billing statement's month occurred.

fee_category.description: Further breaks down the `fee_type` by providing insight into how different fee categories (e.g `VISA BUSINESS TIER 4 - STANDARD` vs. `VISA BUSINESS TIER 3 - STANDARD`) get billed.

fixed_fee_amount.description: The total amount of network and issuer fees for the transactions of the associated `fee_category`. This is a combination of the `variable_fee_bps` and the per-transaction price that networks and issuers charge.

fixed_fee_markup_amount.description: The amount of fixed markup which your platform set for this merchant. This number is represented in cents. This is applied to each item in the billing statement along with `variable_fee_markup_bps` to result in the `total_markup`.

item_count.description: Number of transactions in a billing statement for the given fee type and fee category.

total_amount.description: Total transaction amount in a billing statement for the given fee type and fee category. This includes the net received by the merchant and all fees.

total_fees.description: Total fee amount for the indicated `fee_type` and `fee_category`. The equation for this value is (`total_interchange_fee` + `total_markup`).

total_interchange_fee.description: This is the total fees charged by issuers and networks that the merchant owes for this billing statement. This value is derived from variable bps and fixed fee amount.

total_markup.description: This is the total fees charged by the platform for credit card transactions. This is calculated as (`item_count` * `fixed_fee_markup_amount`) + (`transaction_amount` * `variable_fee_markup_bps`).

variable_fee_bps.description: Basis points to calculate variable fee amount per transaction. Basis points translate directly to percent, so a value of `295` here will be calculated as 2.95% against the `amount` of each item in the billing statement. For credit card transactions, this parameter represents variable network and issuer fees. For ACH payments, this value will be the entire variable processing fee.

variable_fee_markup_bps.description: Basis points to calculate variable markup fee amount. Basis points translate directly to percent, so a value of `20` here will be calculated as 0.2%. For credit card transactions, this parameter represents variable platform fees. For ACH payments, the value here will be `0`.

month.description: Returns when the value for `fee_type` is `ADJUSTMENT`, and indicates the month in which the adjustment occurred. This will typically be the same month as the billing statement.

billing_statements_id_fees_summary_respo.description: An array of fee information for the given `fee_type` and `fee_category`.

day.description: Defines the day of the month which the transactions summary array object is reporting on.

item_count.description: The number of transactions the merchant processed on the transaction summary's given date (`month`, `day`, & `year`).

month.description: Defines the month of the year which the transactions summary array object is reporting on.

summaries.description: An array containing transaction information for the transactions summary's given date (`month`, `day`, & `year`) organized by `fee_type`.

total_amount.description: This is the gross ((merchant's net settlement) + ( total fees)) amount the merchant processed on the transactions summary's given date (`month`, `day`, & `year`).

year.description: Defines the year which the transactions summary array object is reporting on.

amount.description: The amount under dispute. If the dispute amount differs from the transaction amount, there is either [a partial dispute or an exchange rate fluctuation](/payments-101/disputes-deep-dive/#differing-dispute-and-transaction-amounts).

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code. Possible values include: `CAD`, `USD`.

explanation.description: A free-form textual description from the merchant.

documentation.description: Documentation provided by your merchant to challenge the dispute.

fee.description: Specifies whether an app fee will be collected and who should pay the app fee.

id.description: ID of the dispute, generated by WePay when the dispute is created.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

resolution_time.description: Time (in UNIX) when the dispute was resolved.

x-enumDescriptions.won: Indicates that the dispute has been resolved in favor of the merchant (i.e. funds have been credited back to the merchant).
x-enumDescriptions.lost: Indicates that the dispute has been resolved in favor of the payer (i.e. the funds will not be returned to the merchant).
x-enumDescriptions.pending: Indicates that the dispute has not been resolved either way at this point.
x-enumDescriptions.expired: Indicates that the dispute has expired due to inaction.

type.description: Type of resolution. Possible values include: `won`: the dispute was resolved in favor of the merchant; `lost`: the dispute was resolved in favor of the payer; `pending`: the dispute has not been resolved yet; `expired`: The dispute has not been challenged or conceded, so it has expired.

resolution.description: The ultimate resolution to the dispute.

status.description: Status of the dispute. Possible values include: `awaiting_payee_response`, `awaiting_chargeback_decision`, `pending_wepay_review`, `resolved`,`awaiting_chargeback_decision_with_credit`,'awaiting_chargeback_decision_without_credit'.

x-enumDescriptions.awaiting_merchant_response: The merchant has not provided any response to the dispute. If the merchant want to attempt to recoup these funds, they must upload documentation supporting the charge.
x-enumDescriptions.pending_wepay_review: WePay is reviewing the dispute and any documentation submitted by the merchant. Once WePay's review is complete, the status will be updated.
x-enumDescriptions.awaiting_chargeback_decision: The card issuer is reviewing the dispute and all related evidence and documentation. Once the card issuer's review is complete, the status will be updated.
x-enumDescriptions.resolved: The dispute has been resolved. Find more information in the resolution JSON block.
x-enumDescriptions.awaiting_chargeback_decision_with_credit: The card issuer is reviewing the dispute and all related evidence and documentation. Until a final decision is made, the merchant has a credit for the amount of the dispute and fees. Note that if the dispute is ultimately resolved in favor of the payer, this credit will be reversed and debited from the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.awaiting_chargeback_decision_without_cre: The card issuer is reviewing the dispute and all related evidence and documentation. The merchant will not receive a credit for the dispute while this process takes place. If the dispute is resolved in favor of the merchant, then the merchant will receive the funds back.

type.description: Type of dispute. Possible values include: `chargeback`, `inquiry`, `debit_adjustment`.

x-enumDescriptions.inquiry: Some card brands like AmEx will issue an inquiry to get more information about a charge. If inquiries are not responded to, the inquiry will be closed and a dispute will be created.
x-enumDescriptions.chargeback: When a chargeback occurs, it means that the card holder or card issuer does not believe the payment should have been made. Merchants can challenge a dispute by uploading documentation.
x-enumDescriptions.second_chargeback: When a second chargeback occurs, it means that the merchant challenged the original dispute which was then resolved in favor of the merchant. Then, either the card holder or card issuer provides additional evidence regarding the dispute, so the same transaction is disputed again.
x-enumDescriptions.debit_adjustment: When a debit adjustment occurs, it means that there is a change that needs to be made against the original transaction, could either debit or credit the merchant.

account_id.description: ID of the merchant account, generated by WePay when the account is created.

count_auths_captured.description: Numbers of authorizations that are captured at the terminal since the terminal has been onboarded.

count_auths_declined.description: Numbers of authorizations that are declined at the terminal since the terminal has been onboarded.

count_auths_pending.description: Numbers of authorizations that are pending at the terminal since the terminal has been onboarded.

create_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX seconds) for the creation of the terminal report record.

id.description: The terminal ID associated with the terminal information record.

model.description: The model of the physical terminal. **Note:** Models `ingenico_lane3000` and `xac_at170r` are currently only usable in the stage environment. If you are interested in using these models, please reach out to your integration team or account manager at WePay.

x-enumDescriptions.ingenico_lane3000: This terminal is a an Ingenico Lane 3000. **Note:** This model is not generally available.
x-enumDescriptions.xac_at170r: This terminal is a an XAC AT170R, used in WePay's [Smart POS](/card-present/procure-smartpos/#xac-at170r) solution.

serial_number.description: The serial number of the physical terminal.

contactless_payments.description: The response schema for contactless payments configuration.

x-enumDescriptions.credit: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, automatically process the authorization as credit.
x-enumDescriptions.debit: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, automatically process the authorization as debit.

credit_debit_preference.description: Determines how the terminal should prefer to charge contactless cards. `credit` is the EMV default, selecting the highest priority application in the card (which is the credit application). Debit preferred attempts to select debit network application on the card first.

Determines how the terminal should prefer credit vs debit when a card is dipped. `credit` indicates credit is the preferred application selection, whereas `debit` would prefer the debit application. `prompt` will perform the EMV default behavior, which is to prompt if multiple applications exist.

x-enumDescriptions.credit: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, automatically process the authorization as credit.
x-enumDescriptions.debit: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, automatically process the authorization as debit.
x-enumDescriptions.prompt: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, prompt the user to make a selection on the terminal.

maintenance_window.description: Configuration settings for the maintenance window of the physical terminal. Omitting the maintenance window field will result in the use of default values for the field's start and duration.

duration.description: The duration of the maintenance window in hours.

start.description: The hour of the day that the maintenance window begins.

name.description: The human readable name used to help identify the physical terminal.

receipt_header_merchant_name.description: Specify the merchant name to print on receipts. If left null, the account `name` will be used on receipts. **Note:** strings longer than 24 characters will wrap to two lines on receipts printed from Terminals with a built-in printer.

signature_required.description: Whether or not this terminal requires signature verification from payers.

sim_card_id.description: The identifier of the SIM card installed in the terminal. Nullable if terminal does not have a SIM card.

hardware_reports.description: Contains details relevant to the terminal.

create_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the payment was created.

id.description: ID of the order, generated by WePay when the order is created.

path.description: The HTTP path of the resource. The path can be used to retrieve details about the resource and perform actions on it.

product_name.description: The name of the product or service your user signed up for on your platform.

state.description: State of the item. Possible values: `active`, `deleted`.

account_id.description: Merchant's account id associated with the item.

description.description: Description of the product or service.

price.description: Price of the item or service.

product_details.description: Any product details your platform chooses to attach to this resource. The product detail data must be key-value pairs. For example, a pair of black running shoes could have "category1":"Clothing, Shoes, and Accessories", "category2":"Women's shoes", "color":"black".

shipping_options.description: Description of each available shipping option.

description.description: Description of the Legal Entity. WePay uses this information for underwriting purposes.

x-enumDescriptions.XX: WePay's custom 2-digit ISO code for Crimea Region, as a 2-digit code does not exist.

operates_in_sanctioned_countries.description: An array of sanctioned countries where the Legal Entity operates. Possible values include `CU`, `IR`, `KP`, `XX`, `SY`. Note that `XX` is used to represent Crimea, as it does not have its own 2-digit ISO code. If the merchant indicates they do not have operations in one of the sanctioned countries listed above, then pass an empty array: `[]`. This field is required, if the value is left `null`, capabilities (payments and payouts) will be disabled.

year_of_formation.description: The year when the Legal Entity originated.

entity_name.description: The name of the legal entity. This should **not** contain a merchant's DBA; DBAs can be included on the Account resource. Must not contain the word `wepay`.

id.description: ID of the legal entity, generated by WePay when the legal entity is created.

acceptance_time.description: Time (in UNIX) when WePay's Terms of Service was accepted.

original_ip.description: The IP address in use when WePay's Terms of Service was accepted.

terms_of_service_version.description: The version of WePay's Terms of Service that was accepted.

terms_of_service.description: Data regarding the legal entity's acceptance of the WePay terms of service.

attester_type.description: Describes by whom a legal entity is attested. The value will be `controller` unless your platform has permission from WePay to collect attestation from other representatives.

x-enumDescriptions.additional_representative: **This option requires permission.** The legal entity is attested by one of the additional representatives.
x-enumDescriptions.controller: The legal entity is attested by the controller.
x-enumDescriptions.other_representative: **This option requires permission.** The legal entity is attested by other representative.

attestation.description: Indicate that the controller has attested to the validity of CIP/KYC details submitted. Find more information [here](/clear/options/kyc-and-cip-certification/#attestation).

preferred_locale.description: The preferred locale of the legal entity. For merchants using the WePay Merchant Center, or receiving payments emails from WePay, this option will set the language preference.

x-enumDescriptions.en_US: Locale string representing English - United States
x-enumDescriptions.es_US: Locale string representing Spanish - United States

affiliations.description: Information about all of the significant beneficiaries' affiliations. 10 affiliations are allowed at most.

geographies.description: Information about significant beneficiaries' geographic locations, including `regional` and `international` details.

non_domestic_location_beneficiaries.description: **Note:** Although this is nested in the `significant_beneficiaries` object, this information must be collected for all non-domestic beneficiaries, even if they receive or control less than 10% of the organization's funds.

significant_beneficiaries.description: Identify significant beneficiaries. **Note:** A significant beneficiary either receives or is responsible for 10% or more of the organization's funds.

significant_donors.description: Identify significant donors. **Note:** A significant donor contributes 10% or more of the organization's total volume.

documents.description: An array of document IDs. The document IDs are returned via the document upload feature in the JavaScript library. These documents will be used for identity verification. Check out Document Upload for more details.

status.description: Status of the notification preference. Possible values are: `active`, `unreachable`, `deleted`.

x-enumDescriptions.active: The notification preference is active and ready to be used.
x-enumDescriptions.deleted: The notification preference has already been deleted.
x-enumDescriptions.unreachable: The notification preference is unreachable. Please create a new one.

alternate_tax_amount.description: Total amount of alternate tax for the order.

alternate_tax_id.description: Your platform's tax ID number to use for the alternate tax amount. **Required** if you set `alternate_tax_amount` to any value. However, you may fill out this field without setting `alternate_tax_amount`.

create_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the payout method was created.

customer_reference_number.description: The ID used to identify the order instance between a merchant and payer.

delivery_type.description: Describes how an order is delivered. Possible values: `donation`, `full_prepayment`, `fully_delivered`, `none`, `partial_prepayment`, `point_of_sale`, `subscription`.

x-enumDescriptions.none: Indicates that the order does not contain shippable goods.
x-enumDescriptions.fully_delivered: Indicates that all components of an order have been delivered and received by the payer.
x-enumDescriptions.point_of_sale: Indicates that the transaction took place in a Card Present environment, and the payer received goods or services in-person at the time of transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.donation: Indicates that the transaction was a donation, and no delivery of goods or services is expected.

discount_program_name.description: The name of the discount program applied to the transaction. This allows tracking if a merchant offers multiple discount programs at once or over time.

duty_amount.description: Total charges for any import or export duties included in the order.

grand_total_amount.description: Grand total for the entire order or credit request.

total_amount.description: The total amount due for the line item.

commodity_code.description: Code used to classify imported and exported items.

description.description: Text description (especially for services and invoices). **Required** if Item is not provided.

tax_amount.description: The total tax amount associated with the line item.

tax_rate.description: The tax rate applied to the line item total.

tax_type_applied.description: The type of tax applied for the line item. Possible values include: `personal`, `business`.

unit_of_measure.description: The unit of measure relative to the line item.

line_items.description: An array of line items. Not a top level resource.

long_description.description: A long description of the order.

notes.description: Notes field from the invoice or order.

path.description: The path of resource and resource ID.

reference_number.description: A reference number your platform assigns to the order to help you identify it.

actual_delivery_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when goods or services were actually delivered.

expected_delivery_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when items or services are expected to be delivered.

shipping_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when items were shipped.

tracking_number.description: The tracking number for the shipping carrier.

shipping_status.description: Shipping status details associated with the order.

short_description.description: A short description of the order. **Required** if `line_items` are not provided.

state.description: State of the order. Possible values: `active`, `inactive`.

x-enumDescriptions.active: The Order contains information that is current and applicable to the associated Payment.
x-enumDescriptions.deleted: the Order contains information that is not current or applicable to the associated Payment and has been deleted.

status.description: Status of the order. Possible values: `disputed`, `paid`, `unpaid`, `deleted`.

x-enumDescriptions.unpaid: The order has not yet been paid.
x-enumDescriptions.disputed: The order was paid, but the transaction has since received a chargeback.

tax_amount.description: Total tax amount applied to the transaction. Must be greater than `0` to qualify for Level 2 Interchange for Visa.

tip_amount.description: Total Tip amount applied to the transaction. Must be greater than `0` to qualify for Level 2 Interchange for Visa.

x-enumDescriptions.service: This order outlines services being paid for.

vat_amount.description: Total amount of VAT or other tax included in the order.

vat_rate.description: Rate of VAT or other tax for the order. The valid range is 0.01 to 0.99 (1% to 99%).

account_type.description: The account type. Possible values include: `checking`, `savings`.

x-enumDescriptions.checking: If the payer's bank account is a checking account, they must select this option in order to successfully verify their payment method.
x-enumDescriptions.savings: If the payer's bank account is a savings account, they must select this option in order to successfully verify their payment method.

type.description: Your platform can only provide two entries. If you embed legal entity information inline set type to `legal_entity_id`.

legal_entity_id.description: Merchant's Legal Entity ID associated with the order.

shared_buyer_request.description: Buyer of the order. **Required** if the order is not created in-line with a /payment_methods request.

amount.description: Amount in the lowest denomination.

capture_at.description: For payments with a credit card payment method, designate the time at which this payment will capture using a UNIX epoch timestamp. The capture time cannot be more than 7 days in the future. Note that epoch timestamps use the UTC timezone.

id.description: ID of the payment, generated by WePay when the payment is created.

x-enumDescriptions.pending: This payment is processing, but is not yet included in the account's available or reserve balance. Find more information in the `pending_reasons` structure.
x-enumDescriptions.completed: This payment has finished processing, and is now available in either the account's available or reserved balance. **Note:** A payment can have a completed status and simultaneously have a refund or dispute issued against it.
x-enumDescriptions.failed: This payment has failed to process, and cannot be made available to the merchant. Find more information in the `failure_reason` structure.
x-enumDescriptions.canceled: This payment was canceled. If the cancellation was inadvertent, a new payment will need to be created.

status.description: Status of the payment. Possible values include: `canceled` `completed`, `failed`, `pending`.

auto_capture.description: For payments with a credit card payment method, set to `false` to create a delayed-capture payment. Capture the payment within 7 days with the [POST /payments/{id}/capture](/api/latest/operation/POST_payments-id-capture/) endpoint. Alternatively, cancel the payment with the [POST /payments/{id}/cancel](/api/latest/operation/POST_payments-id-cancel/) endpoint.

fee_amount.description: Specifies the fee amount your platform will collect from the payment. The amount should be in the lowest denomination. **Note:** Platforms leveraging the blended rate pricing model should use this parameter. This parameter is not applicable to platforms leveraging the Merchant IC+ pricing model.

pending_reasons.description: Explains why this payment is pending and may contain an array of reasons.

id.description: ID of the payment method, generated by WePay when the payment method is created.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

x-enumDescriptions.unverified: This payment method has not been verified yet and cannot be used to create payments until the status updates to `verified`.
x-enumDescriptions.verified: This payment method has successfully been verified and can now be used to create payments.
x-enumDescriptions.verification_failed: Verification attempt(s) for this payment method have failed. If this value returns, the payer should double check their payment details and re-submit them.
x-enumDescriptions.deleted: This payment method has been permanently deleted and cannot be used to create any further payments.

type.description: Type of payment method. Possible values include: `credit_card`, `payment_bank_us`, `payment_method_id`, `encoded_payment_method`.

x-enumDescriptions.credit_card: This value is required if the `credit_card` structure is being sent with raw credit card data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_us: This value is required if the `payment_bank_us` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_ca: This value is required if the `payment_bank_ca` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.
x-enumDescriptions.encoded_payment_method: This value is required if the `encoded_payment_method` structure is being sent with the payment blob from the Card Present SDK.
x-enumDescriptions.google_pay: This value is required if the `google_pay` structure is being sent with google pay data.

card_on_file.description: Indicates if the resulting token will be kept on file as a non-recurring payment method.

expiration_month.description: The month the credit card expires.

expiration_year.description: The year the credit card expires.

recurring.description: Indicates if the resulting token will be kept on file as a recurring payment method.

auto_update.description: Automatically update credit cards that have been stored with WePay. If a card is expired, or has been replaced (e.g., due to theft), it will be automatically updated based in information provided by card networks. To receive these updates, be sure to [subscribe](/api/latest/operation/POST_notification_preferences/) to the `payment_methods.updated` notification event topic.

backing_display_name.description: The backing display name for the credit card.

bin.description: Bank identification number. The initial six digits of a credit card number. Null is returned if BIN is not available.

card_brand.description: Brand of the credit card. Possible values include: `amex`, `discover`, `diners`, `jcb`, `mastercard`, `visa`.

display_name.description: The display name for the credit card.

last_four.description: The last four digits of the credit card number.

x-enumDescriptions.mobile: Indicates that the virtual terminal transaction was completed in a Card Present environment.
x-enumDescriptions.web: Indicates that the virtual terminal transaction was completed in a Card Not Present environment.

virtual_terminal_mode.description: This is set if the merchant manually entered the credit card number. Possible values include: `mobile`, `web`, null.

account_type.description: The account type. Possible values include: `checking`, `savings`.

x-enumDescriptions.checking: If the payer's bank account is a checking account, they must select this option in order to successfully verify their payment method.
x-enumDescriptions.savings: If the payer's bank account is a savings account, they must select this option in order to successfully verify their payment method.

last_four.description: The last four numbers of the bank account. **Note:** If you have verified your account via Plaid, this might be the last four numbers of your tokenized bank account number (TAN).

id.description: ID of the payout, generated by WePay when the payout is created.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

amount.description: Amount in cents.

complete_time.description: The time (in UNIX) the payout was completed.

create_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the payout was created.

x-enumDescriptions.pending: WePay is currently processing this payout. See the `pending_reasons` structure for additional information.
x-enumDescriptions.completed: WePay has finished processing this payout. **Note:** Other bank institutions must also process payouts to bank accounts before the merchant will see the deposit in their account.
x-enumDescriptions.failed: WePay failed to process this payout. See the `failure_reason` structure for additional information.

id.description: The ID of the payout method, generated by WePay when the payout method is created.

path.description: The path of resource and resource ID.

create_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the payout method was created.

nickname.description: The nickname of the payout method.

memo.description: The memo that will be used on the check

paper_check.description: Define how to payout a merchant based in the US via paper check. **Note:** Paper checks require permission from WePay, and only US-based merchants can receive payouts via paper check. Reach out to your integration team for further information.

account_type.description: The account type. Possible values include: `checking`, `savings`.

x-enumDescriptions.checking: If the merchant's bank account they are setting up for payouts is a checking account, they must select this option for successful payouts.
x-enumDescriptions.savings: If the merchant's bank account they are setting up for payouts is a savings account, they must select this option for successful payouts.

last_four.description: The last four numbers of the credit card.

payout_bank_ca.description: Contains parameters relevant to the payout method.

last_four.description: The last four numbers of the bank account.

payout_bank_gb.description: Contains parameters relevant to the payout method.

account_type.description: The account type. Possible values include: `checking`, `savings`.

x-enumDescriptions.checking: If the merchant's bank account they are setting up for payouts is a checking account, they must select this option for successful payouts.
x-enumDescriptions.savings: If the merchant's bank account they are setting up for payouts is a savings account, they must select this option for successful payouts.

last_four.description: The last four numbers of the bank account.

payout_bank_us.description: Contains parameters relevant to the payout method.

x-enumDescriptions.active: This payout method is active, so it can be queried via the APIs and used as a merchant's payout method.
x-enumDescriptions.disabled: Due to three (3) failed attempts to send payouts to this payout method, it has been disabled. Find more information on the failed payouts by examining the `failure_reason` [object](/api/latest/operation/GET_payouts-id/#!c=200&path=failure_reason&t=response) of the payout resource. Note that disabled payout methods cannot be queried via the APIs or used as a merchant's payout method.
x-enumDescriptions.deleted: This payout method has been deleted, so it cannot be queried via the APIs or used as a merchant's payout method. If the payout method was being used as an account's payout method, a new payout method must be provided before the account's payout capability will be enabled again.

status.description: Describes the status of the specific payout method.

x-enumDescriptions.payout_bank_gb: Bank account in the UK (not currently supported).
x-enumDescriptions.paper_check: Paper check delivered to an address in the US.

type.description: Possible values: `payout_bank_ca`, `payout_bank_us` and `payout_bank_gb`. **Note:** The `paper_check` option requires permission from WePay to use. Reach out to your integration team for assistance.

amount.description: Amount of the recovery.

complete_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the recovery was completed.

create_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the recovery was created.

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code. Possible values include: `CAD`, `GBP`, `USD`.

id.description: ID of the recovery, generated by WePay when the recovery is created.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

pending_reasons.description: Reason why the status is pending and may contain an array of reasons.

x-enumDescriptions.pending: WePay has started processing the recovery, but it is not yet available. Find more details in the `pending_reasons` structure.
x-enumDescriptions.completed: WePay has processed the recovery. Note that a recovery's status can change from `completed` to `failed` if the issuing bank rejects the debit.
x-enumDescriptions.failed: WePay could not process the recovery. Find more information in the `failure_reason` structure.

status.description: Status of the recovery. Possible values include: `completed`, `failed`, `pending`.

create_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the refund was created.

id.description: ID of the refund, generated by WePay when the refund is created.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

pending_reasons.description: Explains why refund is pending and may contain an array of reasons.

status.description: Status of the refund. Possible values include: `pending`, `completed`, `failed`.

account_id.description: The account ID associated with the transaction report record.

create_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX seconds) for the creation of the transaction report record.

id.description: The transaction report record ID, generated by WePay when the record is created.

x-enumDescriptions.payment: Transaction reports relating to incoming payments.
x-enumDescriptions.refund: Transaction reports relating to refunds issued.
x-enumDescriptions.adjustment: Transaction reports relating to any adjustments issued.
x-enumDescriptions.chargeback_reversal: Transaction reports relating to reversed chargebacks.
x-enumDescriptions.recovery: Transaction reports relating to recoveries made.
x-enumDescriptions.payout: Transaction reports relating to payouts made.
x-enumDescriptions.payout_return: Transaction reports relating to payouts returned.

report_type.description: Type of Transaction Report. Possible values: `payment`, `refund`, `adjustment`, `dispute`, `chargeback_reversal`, `recovery`, `payout`, `payout_return`.

terminal_id.description: The terminal ID associated with the transaction report record.

reports_report.description: Contains details relevant to the transaction report.

contactless_payments-req.description: The request schema for modifying contactless payments configuration settings.

enabled.description: Determines if contactless payments are enabled.

x-enumDescriptions.credit: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, automatically process the authorization as credit.
x-enumDescriptions.debit: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, automatically process the authorization as debit.

credit_debit_preference.description: Determines how the terminal should prefer to charge contactless cards. `credit` is the EMV default, selecting the highest priority application in the card (which is the credit application). Debit preferred attempts to select debit network application on the card first.

city.description: City associated with the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

line1.description: First line of the address **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

postal_code.description: Postal code associated with the address.

region.description: Region associated with the address. Expected values are state or province abbreviations for addresses in the US or CA. **Note:** for entity and controller address, the following values are not supported: `PR`, `VI`, `AA`, `AE`, and `AP`.

line2.description: Second line of the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

last_call_home.description: The epoch timestamp of the last time this terminal called home. Null if the terminal has never done so.

model.description: The model of the physical terminal. **Note:** Models `ingenico_lane3000` and `xac_at170r` are currently only usable in the stage environment. If you are interested in using these models, please reach out to your integration team or account manager at WePay.

x-enumDescriptions.ingenico_lane3000: This terminal is a an Ingenico Lane 3000. **Note:** This model is not generally available.
x-enumDescriptions.xac_at170r: This terminal is a an XAC AT170R, used in WePay's [Smart POS](/card-present/procure-smartpos/#xac-at170r) solution.

serial_number.description: The serial number of the terminal.

terminal_application_version.description: The version of the application running on the terminal.

contactless_payments.description: The response schema for contactless payments configuration.

x-enumDescriptions.credit: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, automatically process the authorization as credit.
x-enumDescriptions.debit: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, automatically process the authorization as debit.

credit_debit_preference.description: Determines how the terminal should prefer to charge contactless cards. `credit` is the EMV default, selecting the highest priority application in the card (which is the credit application). Debit preferred attempts to select debit network application on the card first.

Determines how the terminal should prefer credit vs debit when a card is dipped. `credit` indicates credit is the preferred application selection, whereas `debit` would prefer the debit application. `prompt` will perform the EMV default behavior, which is to prompt if multiple applications exist.

x-enumDescriptions.credit: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, automatically process the authorization as credit.
x-enumDescriptions.debit: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, automatically process the authorization as debit.
x-enumDescriptions.prompt: If a card allows credit and debit transactions, prompt the user to make a selection on the terminal.

maintenance_window.description: Configuration settings for the maintenance window of the physical terminal. Omitting the maintenance window field will result in the use of default values for the field's start and duration.

duration.description: The duration of the maintenance window in hours.

start.description: The hour of the day that the maintenance window begins.

name.description: The human readable name used to help identify the physical terminal.

receipt_header_merchant_name.description: Specify the merchant name to print on receipts. If left null, the account `name` will be used on receipts. **Note:** strings longer than 24 characters will wrap to two lines on receipts printed from Terminals with a built-in printer.

signature_required.description: Whether or not this terminal requires signature verification from payers.

sim_card_id.description: The identifier of the SIM card installed in the terminal. Nullable if terminal does not have a SIM card.

gateway_id.description: Unique identifier of the terminal used by our payment gateway

create_time.description: The time (in UNIX) when the transaction record was created.

id.description: ID of the transaction record, generated by WePay when the transaction record is created.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

fee_amount.description: The fee amount applied to the transaction.

gross_amount.description: The gross amount associated with the transaction.

net_amount.description: The net amount associated with the transaction (gross - fee = net).

id.description: The ID of the resource that the transaction record reports on. Possible ID resources include: `adjustments`, `disputes`, `payments`, `payouts`, `recoveries`, `refunds`.

path.description: Path of resource and resource ID.

resource.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

x-enumDescriptions.adjustments: The owner object for this transaction record is an adjustment.
x-enumDescriptions.disputes: The owner object for this transaction record is a dispute.
x-enumDescriptions.payments: The owner object for this transaction record is a payment.
x-enumDescriptions.payouts: The owner object for this transaction record is a payout.
x-enumDescriptions.recoveries: The owner object for this transaction record is a recovery.
x-enumDescriptions.refunds: The owner object for this transaction record is a refund.

owner.description: Owner returns ID and path. Possible values include: `adjustments`, `disputes`, `payments`, `payouts`, `recoveries`, `refunds`.

x-enumDescriptions.merchant_payment: The `net` value is the amount credited to the merchant, the `fee_amount` value is the amount credited the the platform, and the `gross` value is the amount debited from the payer.
x-enumDescriptions.app_fee: The `net` value is the amount kept by the platform, the `fee_amount` value is the amount credited to WePay, and the `gross` value is the amount total amount debited from the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.merchant_payment_refund: The `net` value is the amount debited from the merchant, the `fee_amount` value is the amount debited from the platform, and the `gross` value is the amount credited back to the payer.
x-enumDescriptions.app_fee_refund: The `net` value is the amount debited from the platform, the `fee_amount` value is the amount debited from WePay, and the `gross` value is the total amount in fees credited back to the payer.
x-enumDescriptions.merchant_chargeback: The `net` value is the amount debited from the merchant, the `fee_amount` value is the amount debited from the platform, and the `gross` value is the amount credited back to the payer.
x-enumDescriptions.app_fee_chargeback: The `net` value is the amount debited from the platform, the `fee_amount` value the amount debited from WePay, and the `gross` value is the total amount of fees credited back to the payer.
x-enumDescriptions.merchant_chargeback_fee: The `net` and `fee_amount` values will be the same and show the amount debited from the merchant, gross will be `0`.
x-enumDescriptions.merchant_chargeback_reversal: The `net` value is the amount credited to the merchant, the `fee_amount` value is the amount debited from the merchant and credited to the platform account, and the `gross` value is the amount debited from the payer.
x-enumDescriptions.app_fee_chargeback_reversal: The `net` value is the amount credited to the platform account, the `fee_amount` value is the amount credited to WePay, and the `gross` value is total amount of fees debited from the payer and credited to the platform & WePay.
x-enumDescriptions.payout: The `net` value is the amount credited to the merchant's payout method, the `fee_amount` value is the amount debited from the merchant and credited to the platform account, and the `gross` value is the amount debited from the merchant's account.
x-enumDescriptions.payout_return: The `net` value is the amount credited to the merchant's account, the `fee_amount` value is the amount debited from the gross and credited to the platform account, and the `gross` value is the amount debited from the merchant's payout method.
x-enumDescriptions.recovery: The `net` value is the amount credited to the merchant's account, the `fee_amount` value is the amount debited from the gross and credited to the platform account, and the `gross` value is the amount debited from the merchant's payout method.
x-enumDescriptions.recovery_return: The `net` value is the amount debited from the merchant's account, the `fee_amount` value is the amount debited from the platform account & WePay and credited to , and the `gross` value is the total amount credited to the merchant's payout method.
x-enumDescriptions.adjustment: The `net` value is the amount debited or credited from/to the merchant, the `fee_amount` value is the amount debited or credited from/to the platform account, and the `gross` value is the total amount of the adjustment..

type.description: The type of transaction record. Possible values include: `adjustment`, `app_fee`, `app_fee_chargeback`, `app_fee_chargeback_reversal`, `app_fee_refund`, `merchant_chargeback`, `merchant_chargeback_fee`, `merchant_chargeback_reversal`, `merchant_payment`, `merchant_payment_refund`, `payout`, `payout_return`, `recovery`, `recovery_return`.

transaction_record.description: The response to a [GET /transaction_records/{id}](/api/#/http/api-endpoints/payment-operations/get-a-transaction-record) request. **Note:** Generating transaction records may be delayed for up to 6 hours.

resource-capabilities.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

verified.description: Indicates if the personal verification details of the controller have been verified.

x-enumDescriptions.additional_documents_required: **Note:** This is the default value for additional information during merchant verification, but can be replaced by `identity_verification` by working with your integration team. This value indicates that the merchant must [upload documentation](/api/#/http/guides/document-upload) to allow WePay to complete verification. [Example notification](https://gist.github.com/wehub/edcae2ecefbd76df9e3b3e6a97a954cf).
x-enumDescriptions.errant_fields: This value describes missing or invalid onboarding information.
x-enumDescriptions.identity_verification: **Note:** Work with your integration team to enable this value, which would then replace `additional_documents_required` and enhance the end user experience. The preferred method is `identity_verification`, so please work with your integration team to get this enabled to replace the `additional_documents_required` value. WePay requires documentation in order to verify the identity of the entity, controller, or one of the additional representatives.
x-enumDescriptions.in_review: WePay must review this merchant, and the capability must be disabled until that review is complete.
x-enumDescriptions.risk_outreach: WePay requires documentation in order to properly implement fraud protection for the merchant.

issue_type.description: Indicates the reason(s) the current issue has appeared.

target.description: Indicates the resource associated with the current issue.

additional_documents_required.description: Indicates if additional documentation is required for this specific path. For instance, if examining `controller.personal_verification.current_issues.additional_documents_required`, then any and all required documentation will be presented in this array.

x-enumDescriptions.is_false: This will return if the `controller.email_is_verified` value is `false`. Find out when a controller's email address must be verified [here](/clear/onboard-merchants/#invite-the-controller), and [here](/clear/options/enable-merchants/#enable-payments) for merchants onboarded without the WePay Merchant Center.
x-enumDescriptions.is_null: The target is required information for onboarding, and the merchant must provide this information to continue processing. Find more information in the [Enable Merchants](/clear/options/enable-merchants/) article.
x-enumDescriptions.is_po_box: Addresses must not be a PO box, but rather a residential or business address.
x-enumDescriptions.is_unsupported_value: If a merchant's category code or currency are not supported for a given capability, this issue type will return.
x-enumDescriptions.includes_dba: Business Legal Name should not include Doing Business As (DBA).
x-enumDescriptions.does_not_match_provided_doc: The value of the target does not match provided documentation.
x-enumDescriptions.does_not_match_government_sources: The value of the target does not match government sources.
x-enumDescriptions.invalid_url: WePay cannot verify the URL. The merchant should double check their website URL and submit it again.

errant_fields.description: Indicates which fields need to be updated.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

in_review.description: Indicates if verification information is under review (if any) for this specific path. For instance, if examining `controller.personal_verification.current_issues.additional_documents_required`, and `in_review` is `true`, then this array will contain the path of the item(s) under review.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

items.description: Returns an array of objects identifying why WePay is unable to verify an entity, controller, or additional representative. If there is a single issue, the array will contain an `issue_type`; a `target` array with identifying details about the object, path, and/or parameter(s) relevant to the issue; and another array containing further details from the value of `issue_type`. This last array's key will match the value from `issue_type` and will be one of: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`. If there are multiple issues, then the above collection of objects and parameters will be returned for each issue.  *Note:* Only *one* of the following object will be present, depending on the value of the `issue_type`: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`.

x-enumDescriptions.illegible: Quality of the file or text in the file was such that the document content could not be read.
x-enumDescriptions.corrupt_file: The file could not be used. The merchant must create a new file and try again.
x-enumDescriptions.info_mismatch: The information in the document did not match the information on file for the merchant. The merchant must provide documents with information pertaining to the business, otherwise re-submit the data provided to WePay.
x-enumDescriptions.doc_unsupported: The provided document does not satisfy the requirement from WePay.
x-enumDescriptions.incomplete: The provided document does not completely satisfy the requirements. Additional documents may be requested.

x-enumDescriptions.failed_risk_review: The provided document failed WePay risk review.

reject_reason.description: Describes the reasons a document was rejected.

x-enumDescriptions.in_review: The document has been received and is currently being reviewed by WePay. Once review is complete, the status will be updated.
x-enumDescriptions.verified: WePay was able to verify the information in the document, and no further action is needed for this specific requirement.
x-enumDescriptions.rejected: WePay was unable to verify the document, so the merchant must address the issues listed in the `reject_reason.detail_code` parameter.

documents.description: The document IDs are returned via the document upload feature in the JavaScript library. These documents will be used for identity verification. Check out Document Upload for more details.

personal_verification.description: Personal information for additional beneficial owners of the legal entity. **Note:** You can pass `{}` to signify that this legal entity does not have any additional representatives.

representative_0.description: Personal details of the additional representative.

verified.description: Indicates if the personal verification details of the controller have been verified.

x-enumDescriptions.additional_documents_required: **Note:** This is the default value for additional information during merchant verification, but can be replaced by `identity_verification` by working with your integration team. This value indicates that the merchant must [upload documentation](/api/#/http/guides/document-upload) to allow WePay to complete verification. [Example notification](https://gist.github.com/wehub/edcae2ecefbd76df9e3b3e6a97a954cf).
x-enumDescriptions.errant_fields: This value describes missing or invalid onboarding information.
x-enumDescriptions.identity_verification: **Note:** Work with your integration team to enable this value, which would then replace `additional_documents_required` and enhance the end user experience. The preferred method is `identity_verification`, so please work with your integration team to get this enabled to replace the `additional_documents_required` value. WePay requires documentation in order to verify the identity of the entity, controller, or one of the additional representatives.
x-enumDescriptions.in_review: WePay must review this merchant, and the capability must be disabled until that review is complete.
x-enumDescriptions.risk_outreach: WePay requires documentation in order to properly implement fraud protection for the merchant.

issue_type.description: Indicates the reason(s) the current issue has appeared.

target.description: Indicates the resource associated with the current issue.

additional_documents_required.description: Indicates if additional documentation is required for this specific path. For instance, if examining `controller.personal_verification.current_issues.additional_documents_required`, then any and all required documentation will be presented in this array.

x-enumDescriptions.is_false: This will return if the `controller.email_is_verified` value is `false`. Find out when a controller's email address must be verified [here](/clear/onboard-merchants/#invite-the-controller), and [here](/clear/options/enable-merchants/#enable-payments) for merchants onboarded without the WePay Merchant Center.
x-enumDescriptions.is_null: The target is required information for onboarding, and the merchant must provide this information to continue processing. Find more information in the [Enable Merchants](/clear/options/enable-merchants/) article.
x-enumDescriptions.is_po_box: Addresses must not be a PO box, but rather a residential or business address.
x-enumDescriptions.is_unsupported_value: If a merchant's category code or currency are not supported for a given capability, this issue type will return.
x-enumDescriptions.includes_dba: Business Legal Name should not include Doing Business As (DBA).
x-enumDescriptions.does_not_match_provided_doc: The value of the target does not match provided documentation.
x-enumDescriptions.does_not_match_government_sources: The value of the target does not match government sources.
x-enumDescriptions.invalid_url: WePay cannot verify the URL. The merchant should double check their website URL and submit it again.

errant_fields.description: Indicates which fields need to be updated.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

in_review.description: Indicates if verification information is under review (if any) for this specific path. For instance, if examining `controller.personal_verification.current_issues.additional_documents_required`, and `in_review` is `true`, then this array will contain the path of the item(s) under review.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

items.description: Returns an array of objects identifying why WePay is unable to verify an entity, controller, or additional representative. If there is a single issue, the array will contain an `issue_type`; a `target` array with identifying details about the object, path, and/or parameter(s) relevant to the issue; and another array containing further details from the value of `issue_type`. This last array's key will match the value from `issue_type` and will be one of: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`. If there are multiple issues, then the above collection of objects and parameters will be returned for each issue.  *Note:* Only *one* of the following object will be present, depending on the value of the `issue_type`: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`.

x-enumDescriptions.illegible: Quality of the file or text in the file was such that the document content could not be read.
x-enumDescriptions.corrupt_file: The file could not be used. The merchant must create a new file and try again.
x-enumDescriptions.info_mismatch: The information in the document did not match the information on file for the merchant. The merchant must provide documents with information pertaining to the business, otherwise re-submit the data provided to WePay.
x-enumDescriptions.doc_unsupported: The provided document does not satisfy the requirement from WePay.
x-enumDescriptions.incomplete: The provided document does not completely satisfy the requirements. Additional documents may be requested.

x-enumDescriptions.failed_risk_review: The provided document failed WePay risk review.

reject_reason.description: Describes the reasons a document was rejected.

x-enumDescriptions.in_review: The document has been received and is currently being reviewed by WePay. Once review is complete, the status will be updated.
x-enumDescriptions.verified: WePay was able to verify the information in the document, and no further action is needed for this specific requirement.
x-enumDescriptions.rejected: WePay was unable to verify the document, so the merchant must address the issues listed in the `reject_reason.detail_code` parameter.

documents.description: The document IDs are returned via the document upload feature in the JavaScript library. These documents will be used for identity verification. Check out Document Upload for more details.

personal_verification.description: Personal information for additional beneficial owners of the legal entity. **Note:** You can pass `{}` to signify that this legal entity does not have any additional representatives.

representative_1.description: Personal details of the additional representative.

verified.description: Indicates if the personal verification details of the controller have been verified.

x-enumDescriptions.additional_documents_required: **Note:** This is the default value for additional information during merchant verification, but can be replaced by `identity_verification` by working with your integration team. This value indicates that the merchant must [upload documentation](/api/#/http/guides/document-upload) to allow WePay to complete verification. [Example notification](https://gist.github.com/wehub/edcae2ecefbd76df9e3b3e6a97a954cf).
x-enumDescriptions.errant_fields: This value describes missing or invalid onboarding information.
x-enumDescriptions.identity_verification: **Note:** Work with your integration team to enable this value, which would then replace `additional_documents_required` and enhance the end user experience. The preferred method is `identity_verification`, so please work with your integration team to get this enabled to replace the `additional_documents_required` value. WePay requires documentation in order to verify the identity of the entity, controller, or one of the additional representatives.
x-enumDescriptions.in_review: WePay must review this merchant, and the capability must be disabled until that review is complete.
x-enumDescriptions.risk_outreach: WePay requires documentation in order to properly implement fraud protection for the merchant.

issue_type.description: Indicates the reason(s) the current issue has appeared.

target.description: Indicates the resource associated with the current issue.

additional_documents_required.description: Indicates if additional documentation is required for this specific path. For instance, if examining `controller.personal_verification.current_issues.additional_documents_required`, then any and all required documentation will be presented in this array.

x-enumDescriptions.is_false: This will return if the `controller.email_is_verified` value is `false`. Find out when a controller's email address must be verified [here](/clear/onboard-merchants/#invite-the-controller), and [here](/clear/options/enable-merchants/#enable-payments) for merchants onboarded without the WePay Merchant Center.

x-enumDescriptions.is_po_box: Addresses must not be a PO box, but rather a residential or business address.
x-enumDescriptions.is_unsupported_value: If a merchant's category code or currency are not supported for a given capability, this issue type will return.
x-enumDescriptions.includes_dba: Business Legal Name should not include Doing Business As (DBA).
x-enumDescriptions.does_not_match_provided_doc: The value of the target does not match provided documentation.
x-enumDescriptions.does_not_match_government_sources: The value of the target does not match government sources.
x-enumDescriptions.invalid_url: WePay cannot verify the URL. The merchant should double check their website URL and submit it again.
