representative_3.description: Personal details of the additional representative.

legal_entities_id_verifications_addition.description: Personal information for additional beneficial owners of the legal entity.

resource-verifications.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

resource-tokens.description: Helps organize information by identifying the resource type of the object data.

accounts_incoming_payments_request.description: Identify the payment methods this merchant will accept, and describe this merchant's relationship with card association.

x-enumDescriptions.USD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in US dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.CAD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Canadian dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.GBP: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Great British pounds. **Note:** Not currently supported.

currencies.description: [Merchant IC+ pricing](/pricing/merchant-interchange-plus/) is available exclusively for merchants with a `USD` Account or Blended pricing model.

pricing-create.description: The [Merchant IC+ pricing model](/pricing/merchant-interchange-plus/#define-merchant-ic-pricing) and Blended pricing model to collect platform payment fees from the merchant. Your markup fees should be inclusive of WePay processing fees, which will be debited from your platform Account. For any markup that you define, you'll receive that amount less WePay fees. If you choose to have a lower markup than the fees WePay charges, your Account will be debited to cover the difference.

currencies.description: [Merchant IC+ pricing](/pricing/merchant-interchange-plus/) is available exclusively for merchants with a `USD` Account or Blended pricing model.

pricing-update.description: The [Merchant IC+ pricing model](/pricing/merchant-interchange-plus/#define-merchant-ic-pricing) and Blended pricing model to collect platform payment fees from the merchant. Your markup fees should be inclusive of WePay processing fees, which will be debited from your platform Account. For any markup that you define, you'll receive that amount less WePay fees. If you choose to have a lower markup than the fees WePay charges, your Account will be debited to cover the difference.

reference_number.description: A custom reference number that the platform sets for data mapping.

permissioned-currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code. Possible values include: `CAD` & `USD`. **Note:** as of today, `currency` supports a single value.

x-enumDescriptions.credit_card: This value is required if the `credit_card` structure is being sent with raw credit card data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_us: This value is required if the `payment_bank_us` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_ca: This value is required if the `payment_bank_ca` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_method_id: This value is required if the `payment_method_id` parameter is being sent after a payment method has already been created.
x-enumDescriptions.encoded_payment_method: This value is required if the `encoded_payment_method` structure is being sent with the payment blob from the Card Present SDK.

card_number.description: Card number of the credit card.

expiration_month.description: The month the credit card expires.

expiration_year.description: The year the credit card expires.

auto_update.description: Automatically update credit cards that have been stored with WePay. If a card is expired, or has been replaced (e.g., due to theft), it will be automatically updated based in information provided by card networks. To receive these updates, be sure to [subscribe](/api/latest/operation/POST_notification_preferences/) to the `payment_methods.updated` notification event topic.

card_on_file.description: Indicates if the resulting token will be kept on file as a non-recurring payment method.

cvv.description: Card Verification Value (CVV) of the credit card. Requires permission for CVV optional.

recurring.description: Indicates if the resulting token will be kept on file as a recurring payment method.

trigger_verification.description: When raw credit card data is passed in the `payout_method` structure on a `POST /payments` request, WePay will always pre-authorize the card before requesting an authorization for payment. This means that this parameter *must* be set to `true`. The `trigger_verification` results in a $0 authorization for Visa, MasterCard, and AmericanExpress cards, and a $0.01 authorization for all other card brands. WePay will not reverse this pre-authorization.

x-enumDescriptions.mobile: Indicates that the virtual terminal transaction was completed in a Card Present environment.
x-enumDescriptions.web: Indicates that the virtual terminal transaction was completed in a Card Not Present environment.

virtual_terminal_mode.description: This is set if the merchant manually entered the credit card number. Possible values include: `mobile`, `web`, null.

encoded_payment_method.description: Encoded payment data. Currently is used for POS payment tokens but in future may be used for other types of encoded payment information

payments_payment_method_request.description: The payment method used to create this payment.**Note:** The payment method's top level data object corresponds with the payment method type. For example, if you set type to `credit_card`, then the payment method's top level data object must be `credit_card`.

initiated_by-req.description: Indicates who initiated a payment. Possible values include: `customer`, `merchant`, null. **Note:** This parameter defaults to none when creating a payment unless a credit card payment method has `"card_on_file": "true"`. "Card on file" payments default to customer. For recurring credit card payments: this parameter should be set to `customer` on the first transaction, and then on subsequent recurring transactions, this parameter should be set to `merchant`. This parameter is not used for recurring ACH payments.

short_description.description: A short description of the order. **Required** if `line_items` are not provided.

x-enumDescriptions.service: This order outlines services being paid for.

alternate_tax_amount.description: Total amount of alternate tax for the order.

alternate_tax_id.description: Your platform's tax ID number to use for the alternate tax amount. **Required** if you set `alternate_tax_amount` to any value. However, you may fill out this field without setting `alternate_tax_amount`.

customer_reference_number.description: The ID used to identify the order instance between a merchant and payer.

x-enumDescriptions.none: Indicates that the order does not contain shippable goods.
x-enumDescriptions.fully_delivered: Indicates that all components of an order have been delivered and received by the payer.
x-enumDescriptions.point_of_sale: Indicates that the transaction took place in a Card Present environment, and the payer received goods or services in-person at the time of transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.donation: Indicates that the transaction was a donation, and no delivery of goods or services is expected.

delivery_type.description: Describes how an order is delivered. Possible values: `donation`, `full_prepayment`, `fully_delivered`, `none`, `partial_prepayment`, `point_of_sale`, `subscription`.

discount_program_name.description: The name of the discount program applied to the transaction. This allows tracking if a merchant offers multiple discount programs at once or over time.

duty_amount.description: Total charges for any import or export duties included in the order.

grand_total_amount.description: Grand total for the entire order or credit request.

total_amount.description: The total amount due for the line item.

commodity_code.description: Code used to classify imported and exported items.

description.description: Text description (especially for services and invoices). **Required** if Item is not provided.

tax_amount.description: The total tax amount associated with the line item.

tax_rate.description: The tax rate applied to the line item total.

tax_type_applied.description: The type of tax applied for the line item. Possible values include: `personal`, `business`.

unit_of_measure.description: The unit of measure relative to the line item.

line_items.description: An array of line items. Not a top level resource.

long_description.description: A long description of the order.

notes.description: Notes field from the invoice or order.

reference_number.description: A reference number your platform assigns to the order to help you identify it.

actual_delivery_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when goods or services were actually delivered.

expected_delivery_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when items or services are expected to be delivered.

shipping_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when items were shipped.

tracking_number.description: The tracking number for the shipping carrier.

shipping_status.description: Shipping status details associated with the order.

x-enumDescriptions.unpaid: The order has not yet been paid.
x-enumDescriptions.disputed: The order was paid, but the transaction has since received a chargeback.

status.description: Status of the order. Possible values: `disputed`, `paid`, `unpaid`, `deleted`.

tax_amount.description: Total tax amount applied to the transaction. Must be greater than `0` to qualify for Level 2 Interchange for Visa.

tip_amount.description: Total Tip amount applied to the transaction. Must be greater than `0` to qualify for Level 2 Interchange for Visa.

vat_amount.description: Total amount of VAT or other tax included in the order.

vat_rate.description: Rate of VAT or other tax for the order. The valid range is 0.01 to 0.99 (1% to 99%).

id-order.description: The resource ID of the [order](/api/#/http/api-endpoints/risk/create-an-order) that your app associated with this payment. If no order was associated, then the value will be `null`.

payments_id_amounts_request.description: For Card Present, we allow adjusting the amounts to **greater or less** than the auth amount. For Card Not Present, we allow adjusting the amounts to **less** than the auth amount **for delayed capture only**.

type.description: Type of payment method. Possible values include: `credit_card`, `payment_bank_us`, `payment_method_id`, `encoded_payment_method`.

x-enumDescriptions.credit_card: This value is required if the `credit_card` structure is being sent with raw credit card data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_us: This value is required if the `payment_bank_us` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_ca: This value is required if the `payment_bank_ca` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.
x-enumDescriptions.encoded_payment_method: This value is required if the `encoded_payment_method` structure is being sent with the payment blob from the Card Present SDK.
x-enumDescriptions.google_pay: This value is required if the `google_pay` structure is being sent with google pay data.

card_number.description: Card number of the credit card.

expiration_month.description: The month the credit card expires.

expiration_year.description: The year the credit card expires.

auto_update.description: Automatically update credit cards that have been stored with WePay. If a card is expired, or has been replaced (e.g., due to theft), it will be automatically updated based in information provided by card networks. To receive these updates, be sure to [subscribe](/api/latest/operation/POST_notification_preferences/) to the `payment_methods.updated` notification event topic.

card_on_file.description: Indicates if the resulting token will be kept on file as a non-recurring payment method.

cvv.description: Card Verification Value (CVV) of the credit card. Requires permission for CVV optional.

recurring.description: Indicates if the resulting token will be kept on file as a recurring payment method.

trigger_verification.description: Set this parameter to `true` to pre-authorize the card and validate that it is a functional card. This will result in a $0 authorization for Visa, MasterCard, and AmericanExpress cards, and a $0.01 authorization for all other card brands. WePay will not reverse this authorization.

x-enumDescriptions.mobile: Indicates that the virtual terminal transaction was completed in a Card Present environment.
x-enumDescriptions.web: Indicates that the virtual terminal transaction was completed in a Card Not Present environment.

virtual_terminal_mode.description: This is set if the merchant manually entered the credit card number. Possible values include: `mobile`, `web`, null.

encoded_payment_method.description: Encoded payment data. Currently is used for POS payment tokens but in future may be used for other types of encoded payment information

x-enumDescriptions.payout_bank_gb: Bank account in the UK (not currently supported).
x-enumDescriptions.paper_check: Paper check delivered to an address in the US.

type.description: Possible values: `payout_bank_ca`, `payout_bank_us` and `payout_bank_gb`. **Note:** The `paper_check` option requires permission from WePay to use. Reach out to your integration team for assistance.

memo.description: The memo that will be used on the check

paper_check.description: Define how to payout a merchant based in the US via paper check. **Note:** Paper checks require permission from WePay, and only US-based merchants can receive payouts via paper check. Reach out to your integration team for further information.

account_type.description: The account type. Possible values include: `checking`, `savings`.

x-enumDescriptions.checking: If the merchant's bank account they are setting up for payouts is a checking account, they must select this option for successful payouts.
x-enumDescriptions.savings: If the merchant's bank account they are setting up for payouts is a savings account, they must select this option for successful payouts.

account_type.description: The account type. Possible values include: `checking`, `savings`.

x-enumDescriptions.checking: If the merchant's bank account they are setting up for payouts is a checking account, they must select this option for successful payouts.
x-enumDescriptions.savings: If the merchant's bank account they are setting up for payouts is a savings account, they must select this option for successful payouts.

enabled.description: Indicates if the capability is enabled.

x-enumDescriptions.account_closed: WePay closed the account. Reach out to WePay for further information. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/f35f0b3bb3a8857fb9523cc75c2d56b4).
x-enumDescriptions.account_deleted: This account has been deleted and off-boarded from a platform due to merchants request. Payments and Payout capabilities are disabled. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/213175f37d147951e2b2a3e299c31e50).
x-enumDescriptions.additional_documents_required: This value indicates that the merchant must [upload documentation](/api/#/http/guides/document-upload) to allow WePay to complete verification. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d251f07f6527155225f87b00e353a029).
x-enumDescriptions.application_block: This issue type will only return if your app has permission to use the application block feature, **and** you have blocked an account's payment or payout capability. The `reason` value will be the string submitted by your app when the block was set. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d9e54b7ae580f0e5152dbac6cfaab852).
x-enumDescriptions.closed_for_loss: WePay has closed this merchant because they maintained a negative account balance for more than 60 days. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/0562f0a5f7f961d662a1d32c66dcc981).

current_issues.description: Returns an array of objects identifying why a capability is not enabled. If there is a single issue, the array will contain an `issue_type`; a `target` array with identifying details about the object, path, and/or parameter(s) relevant to the issue; and another array containing further details from the value of `issue_type`. This last array's key will match the value from `issue_type`. If there are multiple issues, then the above collection of objects and parameters will be returned for each issue.  *Note:* Only *one* of the following object will be present, depending on the value of the `issue_type`: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `application_block`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`.

x-enumDescriptions.tos_violation: WePay has closed this merchant due to activity against [Terms of Service](https://go.wepay.com/terms-of-service-us/). [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/301b57d1094ad11d529b35f263a29cda).
x-enumDescriptions.unsupported: WePay cannot support this merchant. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/733eb21e30e7e823c942b575331da5ec).

reason.description: A brief description of why the capabilities block is required.

x-enumDescriptions.is_false: This will return if the `controller.email_is_verified` value is `false`. Find out when a controller's email address must be verified [here](/clear/onboard-merchants/#invite-the-controller), and [here](/clear/options/enable-merchants/#enable-payments) for merchants onboarded without the WePay Merchant Center.
x-enumDescriptions.is_null: The target is required information for onboarding, and the merchant must provide this information to continue processing. Find more information in the [Enable Merchants](/clear/options/enable-merchants/) article.
x-enumDescriptions.is_po_box: Addresses must not be a PO box, but rather a residential or business address.
x-enumDescriptions.is_unsupported_value: If a merchant's category code or currency are not supported for a given capability, this issue type will return.
x-enumDescriptions.is_empty: This will return if the JSON path not exist or JSON object is empty

errant_fields.description: Indicates which fields need to be updated.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

current_issues.description: Returns an array of objects identifying why a capability is not enabled. If there is a single issue, the array will contain an `issue_type`; a `target` array with identifying details about the object, path, and/or parameter(s) relevant to the issue; and another array containing further details from the value of `issue_type`. This last array's key will match the value from `issue_type`. If there are multiple issues, then the above collection of objects and parameters will be returned for each issue.  *Note:* Only *one* of the following object will be present, depending on the value of the `issue_type`: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `application_block`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`.

x-enumDescriptions.account_closed: WePay closed the account. Reach out to WePay for further information. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/f35f0b3bb3a8857fb9523cc75c2d56b4).
x-enumDescriptions.account_deleted: This account has been deleted and off-boarded from a platform due to merchants request. Payments and Payout capabilities are disabled. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/213175f37d147951e2b2a3e299c31e50).
x-enumDescriptions.additional_documents_required: This value indicates that the merchant must [upload documentation](/api/#/http/guides/document-upload) to allow WePay to complete verification. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d251f07f6527155225f87b00e353a029).
x-enumDescriptions.application_block: This issue type will only return if your app has permission to use the application block feature, **and** you have blocked an account's payment or payout capability. The `reason` value will be the string submitted by your app when the block was set. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d9e54b7ae580f0e5152dbac6cfaab852).
x-enumDescriptions.closed_for_loss: WePay has closed this merchant because they maintained a negative account balance for more than 60 days. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/0562f0a5f7f961d662a1d32c66dcc981).
x-enumDescriptions.compliance: WePay has closed this merchant due to regulations which prohibit processing for this merchant. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/857bd478f8126bb0593a3dcfb591b8c6).
x-enumDescriptions.country_not_supported: WePay has closed this merchant due to operations in an unsupported country. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/ae635444f872391e08c7bb5d9e7c2277).
x-enumDescriptions.errant_fields: This value describes missing or invalid onboarding information, and may return any of the following values: `is_null`, `is_po_box`, `is_false`, and `is_unsupported_value`. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/8f77660cc06b3923af5c8e07dd2f38be).
x-enumDescriptions.extended_review: WePay must perform an extensive review of this merchant before considering re-enabling a capability. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d60a4a5539841d0d04c727435966a58c).
x-enumDescriptions.fraud: WePay has closed this merchant due to fraudulent activity on their account. **Do NOT disclose fraud to any users.** [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/bbb300da4539ebdd4d07cf281dd89851).
x-enumDescriptions.high_risk_cb_rate: WePay has closed this merchant due to high risk or a high rate of [disputes](/api/#/http/api-endpoints/payment-operations/get-a-dispute) (also called charge backs). [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/415c6342dd348a2d4ac1c988aeda7de1).
x-enumDescriptions.identity_verification: WePay requires documentation in order to verify the identity of the entity, controller, or one of the additional representatives. Find exactly which documents are required in the `identity_verification` object. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/c9628ed7085ddc063484d299ce67244b).
x-enumDescriptions.in_review: WePay must review this merchant, and the capability must be disabled until that review is complete. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/2cda740d2644741cc6fc6f4965ff2d4d).
x-enumDescriptions.reported_user: WePay has closed this merchant due to a report received from your platform. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/5fe5fe8bd39e99f5eaa844de4cffbb97).
x-enumDescriptions.risk_outreach: WePay requires documentation in order to properly implement fraud protection for the merchant. Find exactly which documents are required in the `risk_outreach` object. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/6f923c62a95d2c9e9d83b105296749ce).
x-enumDescriptions.tos_violation: WePay has closed this merchant due to activity against [Terms of Service](https://go.wepay.com/terms-of-service-us/). [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/301b57d1094ad11d529b35f263a29cda).
x-enumDescriptions.unsupported: WePay cannot support this merchant. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/733eb21e30e7e823c942b575331da5ec).

terminals.description: Details an Account's Terminals capability status, and reasons for a disabled status (i.e. `enabled : false`), if applicable. **Note:** If your platform does not have permission from WePay to use Card Present, then your merchants' terminal capability will never be enabled. This will not impact their ability to process web-based, card-not-present transactions.

transaction_division_setup.description: Details an Account's onboarding status with Chase Merchant Services.

v3.0.rc.1.1-capabilities-resp.description: Outlines an account's payment, payout, and terminal capability status, and reasons for any disabled capabilities. **Note:** If your platform does not have permission from WePay to use Card Present, then your merchants' terminal capability will never be enabled. This will not impact their ability to process web-based, card-not-present transactions.

product_name.description: The name of the product or service your user signed up for on your platform.

account_id.description: Merchant's account id associated with the item.

description.description: Description of the product or service.

price.description: Price of the item or service.

product_details.description: Any product details your platform chooses to attach to this resource. The product detail data must be key-value pairs. For example, a pair of black running shoes could have "category1":"Clothing, Shoes, and Accessories", "category2":"Women's shoes", "color":"black".

shipping_options.description: Description of each available shipping option.

description.description: Description of the product or service.

price.description: Price of the item or service.

product_details.description: Any product details your platform chooses to attach to this resource. The product detail data must be key-value pairs. For example, a pair of black running shoes could have "category1":"Clothing, Shoes, and Accessories", "category2":"Women's shoes", "color":"black".

product_name.description: The name of the product or service your user signed up for on your platform.

shipping_options.description: Description of each available shipping option.

account_id.description: Merchant's account id associated with the order.

short_description.description: A short description of the order. **Required** if `line_items` are not provided.

x-enumDescriptions.service: This order outlines services being paid for.

alternate_tax_amount.description: Merchant's Legal Entity ID associated with the order.

alternate_tax_id.description: Your platform's tax ID number to use for the alternate tax amount. **Required** if you set `alternate_tax_amount` to any value. However, you may fill out this field without setting `alternate_tax_amount`.

customer_reference_number.description: The ID used to identify the order instance between a merchant and payer.

delivery_type.description: Describes how an order is delivered. Possible values: `donation`, `full_prepayment`, `fully_delivered`, `none`, `partial_prepayment`, `point_of_sale`, `subscription`.

x-enumDescriptions.none: Indicates that the order does not contain shippable goods.
x-enumDescriptions.fully_delivered: Indicates that all components of an order have been delivered and received by the payer.
x-enumDescriptions.point_of_sale: Indicates that the transaction took place in a Card Present environment, and the payer received goods or services in-person at the time of transaction.
x-enumDescriptions.donation: Indicates that the transaction was a donation, and no delivery of goods or services is expected.

discount_program_name.description: The name of the discount program applied to the transaction. This allows tracking if a merchant offers multiple discount programs at once or over time.

duty_amount.description: Total charges for any import or export duties included in the order.

grand_total_amount.description: Grand total for the entire order or credit request.

total_amount.description: The total amount due for the line item.

commodity_code.description: Code used to classify imported and exported items.

description.description: Text description (especially for services and invoices). **Required** if Item is not provided.

tax_amount.description: The total tax amount associated with the line item.

tax_rate.description: The tax rate applied to the line item total.

tax_type_applied.description: The type of tax applied for the line item. Possible values include: `personal`, `business`.

unit_of_measure.description: The unit of measure relative to the line item.

line_items.description: An array of line items. Not a top level resource.

long_description.description: A long description of the order.

notes.description: Notes field from the invoice or order.

reference_number.description: A reference number your platform assigns to the order to help you identify it.

actual_delivery_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when goods or services were actually delivered.

expected_delivery_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when items or services are expected to be delivered.

shipping_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when items were shipped.

tracking_number.description: The tracking number for the shipping carrier.

shipping_status.description: Shipping status details associated with the order.

status.description: Status of the order. Possible values: `disputed`, `paid`, `unpaid`, `deleted`.

x-enumDescriptions.unpaid: The order has not yet been paid.
x-enumDescriptions.disputed: The order was paid, but the transaction has since received a chargeback.

tax_amount.description: Total tax amount applied to the transaction. Must be greater than `0` to qualify for Level 2 Interchange for Visa.

tip_amount.description: Total Tip amount applied to the transaction. Must be greater than `0` to qualify for Level 2 Interchange for Visa.

vat_amount.description: Total amount of VAT or other tax included in the order.

vat_rate.description: Rate of VAT or other tax for the order. The valid range is 0.01 to 0.99 (1% to 99%).

alternate_tax_amount.description: Total amount of alternate tax for the order.

alternate_tax_id.description: Your platform's tax ID number to use for the alternate tax amount. **Required** if you set `alternate_tax_amount` to any value. However, you may fill out this field without setting `alternate_tax_amount`.

customer_reference_number.description: The ID used to identify the order instance between a merchant and payer.

delivery_type.description: Describes how an order is delivered. Possible values: `donation`, `full_prepayment`, `fully_delivered`, `none`, `partial_prepayment`, `point_of_sale`, `subscription`.

x-enumDescriptions.donation: Indicates that the transaction was a donation, and no delivery of goods or services is expected.

reference_number.description: A reference number your platform assigns to the order to help you identify it.

actual_delivery_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when goods or services were actually delivered.

expected_delivery_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when items or services are expected to be delivered.

shipping_time.description: The timestamp (in UNIX) when items were shipped.

tracking_number.description: The tracking number for the shipping carrier.

shipping_status.description: Shipping status details associated with the order.

short_description.description: A short description of the order. **Required** if `line_items` are not provided.

status.description: Status of the order. Possible values: `disputed`, `paid`, `unpaid`, `deleted`.

x-enumDescriptions.unpaid: The order has not yet been paid.
x-enumDescriptions.disputed: The order was paid, but the transaction has since received a chargeback.

tax_amount.description: Total tax amount applied to the transaction. Must be greater than `0` to qualify for Level 2 Interchange for Visa.

tip_amount.description: Total Tip amount applied to the transaction. Must be greater than `0` to qualify for Level 2 Interchange for Visa.

x-enumDescriptions.service: This order outlines services being paid for.

vat_amount.description: Total amount of VAT or other tax included in the order.

vat_rate.description: Rate of VAT or other tax for the order. The valid range is 0.01 to 0.99 (1% to 99%).

payout_method_id.description: ID of the payout method associated with the USD payout.

x-enumDescriptions.daily: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every day. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.weekly: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every week on Monday. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.monthly: WePay will send the value of an Account's available balance to the linked Payout Method every month on the 1st, and the available balance will then become $0. If an Account's available balance is already $0, then no Payout will be sent.

period.description: Describes the how often a USD payout will occur.

next_payout_time.description: Describes when the next USD payout will occur.

payout_method_id.description: ID of the payout method associated with the USD payout.

x-enumDescriptions.daily: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every day. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.weekly: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every week on Monday. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.monthly: WePay will send the value of an Account's available balance to the linked Payout Method every month on the 1st, and the available balance will then become $0. If an Account's available balance is already $0, then no Payout will be sent.

period.description: Describes the how often a USD payout will occur.

x-enumDescriptions.USD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in US dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.CAD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Canadian dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.GBP: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Great British pounds. **Note:** Not currently supported.

balances.description: Displays balances pertaining to the merchant account.

description.description: Short description of the merchant account.

x-enumDescriptions.fee_disclosure: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the fee disclosure presented to the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.invoice: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is an invoice presented to the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.tracking: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is for general tracking purposes
x-enumDescriptions.drivers_license: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the driver's license presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.passport: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the passport presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.evidence_of_corporate_registration: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the evidence of corporate registration presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.evidence_of_authority: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the evidence of authority presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_bank_statement: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current bank statement presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.evidence_of_nonprofit_registration: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the evidence of non profit registration presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.social_security_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the social security card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_utility_bill: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current utility bill presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.other_government_issued_photo_id: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is other government issued photo id presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_lease_contract: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current lease contract presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.birth_certificate: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the birth certificate presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.not_applicable: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is not applicable.
x-enumDescriptions.certificate_of_citizenship: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the certificate of citizenship presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.permanent_resident_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the permanent resident card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.employment_authorization_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the employment authorization card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.benefits_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the benefits card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.social_insurance_number_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the social insurance number card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.miscellaneous_compliance_doc: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the miscellaneous compliance document presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.business_report: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the business report presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.negative_media_searches: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the negative media searches presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.person_report: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the person report presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.mortgage_statement: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the mortgage statement presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.certified_copy_of_court_order: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the certified copy of the court order presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_local_tax_bill: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current local tax bill presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.certificate_of_naturalization: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the certificate of naturalization presented by the merchant.

documents.description: An array of documents attached to this merchant to verify fee disclosure.

category_detail.description: Details about the merchant's industry category.

merchant_category_code.description: Category code associated with the merchant's industry.

industry.description: Categorizes the type of service or item a merchant is providing.

name.description: Name of the merchant account; use the "Doing Business As" title for the merchant. Must not contain the word `wepay`. **Note:** Account names can include any regex word character.

platform_onboarding_time.description: The Unix epoch time (in seconds) when the account finished onboarding to the platform.

statement_description.description: A non-empty, ASCII-printable string that does **not** contain the word WePay. This will appear on payers' credit card statements. **Note:** The API allows up to 255 characters, but card issuers will only print 12-14 characters on statements. Find more information [here](/clear/onboard-merchants/).

accepted_method_of_payments.description: Provide the merchant's identifiers with different card brands they accept as methods of payment.

convenience_fee_amount.description: Describe the [convenience fees](/clear/certify/card-network-rules/#convenience-fees) for [Merchant IC+](/pricing/merchant-interchange-plus/) accounts in cents.

enhanced_review.description: Indicates if the account is under enhanced review by WePay.

city.description: City associated with the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

line1.description: First line of the address **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

postal_code.description: Postal code associated with the address.

region.description: Region associated with the address. Expected values are state or province abbreviations for addresses in the US or CA. **Note:** for entity and controller address, the following values are not supported: `PR`, `VI`, `AA`, `AE`, and `AP`.

line2.description: Second line of the address. **non-ecma-262 regex constraint: must not contain "[^\p{L}\p{M}\p{N}\p{P}\p{Z}\p{Cf}\p{Cs}\s]+".**

onboarding_location.description: Address of the legal entity, controller, or additional representatives. When representing the entity's address, send the entity's address of operation. When representing the controller or additional representative send the individual's residential address.

projected_monthly_transaction_volume.description: The projected monthly transaction volume, TPV, of an account.

referral_partner.description: The non ISV partner/solution that refers merchants for payment processing services

x-enumDescriptions.internet: The merchant will process card-not-present web transactions.
x-enumDescriptions.retail: The merchant will process card-present transactions.

x-enumDescriptions.USD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in US dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.CAD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Canadian dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.GBP: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Great British pounds. **Note:** Not currently supported.

enabled.description: Indicates if the capability is enabled.

x-enumDescriptions.account_closed: WePay closed the account. Reach out to WePay for further information. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/f35f0b3bb3a8857fb9523cc75c2d56b4).
x-enumDescriptions.account_deleted: This account has been deleted and off-boarded from a platform due to merchants request. Payments and Payout capabilities are disabled. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/213175f37d147951e2b2a3e299c31e50).
x-enumDescriptions.additional_documents_required: This value indicates that the merchant must [upload documentation](/api/#/http/guides/document-upload) to allow WePay to complete verification. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d251f07f6527155225f87b00e353a029).
x-enumDescriptions.application_block: This issue type will only return if your app has permission to use the application block feature, **and** you have blocked an account's payment or payout capability. The `reason` value will be the string submitted by your app when the block was set. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d9e54b7ae580f0e5152dbac6cfaab852).
x-enumDescriptions.closed_for_loss: WePay has closed this merchant because they maintained a negative account balance for more than 60 days. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/0562f0a5f7f961d662a1d32c66dcc981).
x-enumDescriptions.compliance: WePay has closed this merchant due to regulations which prohibit processing for this merchant. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/857bd478f8126bb0593a3dcfb591b8c6).
x-enumDescriptions.country_not_supported: WePay has closed this merchant due to operations in an unsupported country. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/ae635444f872391e08c7bb5d9e7c2277).
x-enumDescriptions.errant_fields: This value describes missing or invalid onboarding information, and may return any of the following values: `is_null`, `is_po_box`, `is_false`, and `is_unsupported_value`. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/8f77660cc06b3923af5c8e07dd2f38be).
x-enumDescriptions.extended_review: WePay must perform an extensive review of this merchant before considering re-enabling a capability. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d60a4a5539841d0d04c727435966a58c).
x-enumDescriptions.fraud: WePay has closed this merchant due to fraudulent activity on their account. **Do NOT disclose fraud to any users.** [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/bbb300da4539ebdd4d07cf281dd89851).
x-enumDescriptions.high_risk_cb_rate: WePay has closed this merchant due to high risk or a high rate of [disputes](/api/#/http/api-endpoints/payment-operations/get-a-dispute) (also called charge backs). [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/415c6342dd348a2d4ac1c988aeda7de1).
x-enumDescriptions.identity_verification: WePay requires documentation in order to verify the identity of the entity, controller, or one of the additional representatives. Find exactly which documents are required in the `identity_verification` object. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/c9628ed7085ddc063484d299ce67244b).
x-enumDescriptions.in_review: WePay must review this merchant, and the capability must be disabled until that review is complete. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/2cda740d2644741cc6fc6f4965ff2d4d).
x-enumDescriptions.reported_user: WePay has closed this merchant due to a report received from your platform. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/5fe5fe8bd39e99f5eaa844de4cffbb97).
x-enumDescriptions.risk_outreach: WePay requires documentation in order to properly implement fraud protection for the merchant. Find exactly which documents are required in the `risk_outreach` object. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/6f923c62a95d2c9e9d83b105296749ce).
x-enumDescriptions.tos_violation: WePay has closed this merchant due to activity against [Terms of Service](https://go.wepay.com/terms-of-service-us/). [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/301b57d1094ad11d529b35f263a29cda).
x-enumDescriptions.unsupported: WePay cannot support this merchant. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/733eb21e30e7e823c942b575331da5ec).

reason.description: A brief description of why the capabilities block is required.

x-enumDescriptions.is_false: This will return if the `controller.email_is_verified` value is `false`. Find out when a controller's email address must be verified [here](/clear/onboard-merchants/#invite-the-controller), and [here](/clear/options/enable-merchants/#enable-payments) for merchants onboarded without the WePay Merchant Center.
x-enumDescriptions.is_null: The target is required information for onboarding, and the merchant must provide this information to continue processing. Find more information in the [Enable Merchants](/clear/options/enable-merchants/) article.
x-enumDescriptions.is_po_box: Addresses must not be a PO box, but rather a residential or business address.
x-enumDescriptions.is_unsupported_value: If a merchant's category code or currency are not supported for a given capability, this issue type will return.
x-enumDescriptions.is_empty: This will return if the JSON path not exist or JSON object is empty

errant_fields.description: Indicates which fields need to be updated.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

current_issues.description: Returns an array of objects identifying why a capability is not enabled. If there is a single issue, the array will contain an `issue_type`; a `target` array with identifying details about the object, path, and/or parameter(s) relevant to the issue; and another array containing further details from the value of `issue_type`. This last array's key will match the value from `issue_type`. If there are multiple issues, then the above collection of objects and parameters will be returned for each issue.  *Note:* Only *one* of the following object will be present, depending on the value of the `issue_type`: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `application_block`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`.

If there are multiple issues, then the above collection of objects and parameters will be returned for each issue.  *Note:* Only *one* of the following object will be present, depending on the value of the `issue_type`: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `application_block`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`.

x-enumDescriptions.account_closed: WePay closed the account. Reach out to WePay for further information. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/f35f0b3bb3a8857fb9523cc75c2d56b4).
x-enumDescriptions.account_deleted: This account has been deleted and off-boarded from a platform due to merchants request. Payments and Payout capabilities are disabled. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/213175f37d147951e2b2a3e299c31e50).
x-enumDescriptions.additional_documents_required: This value indicates that the merchant must [upload documentation](/api/#/http/guides/document-upload) to allow WePay to complete verification. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d251f07f6527155225f87b00e353a029).
x-enumDescriptions.application_block: This issue type will only return if your app has permission to use the application block feature, **and** you have blocked an account's payment or payout capability. The `reason` value will be the string submitted by your app when the block was set. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d9e54b7ae580f0e5152dbac6cfaab852).
x-enumDescriptions.closed_for_loss: WePay has closed this merchant because they maintained a negative account balance for more than 60 days. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/0562f0a5f7f961d662a1d32c66dcc981).
x-enumDescriptions.compliance: WePay has closed this merchant due to regulations which prohibit processing for this merchant. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/857bd478f8126bb0593a3dcfb591b8c6).
x-enumDescriptions.country_not_supported: WePay has closed this merchant due to operations in an unsupported country. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/ae635444f872391e08c7bb5d9e7c2277).
x-enumDescriptions.errant_fields: This value describes missing or invalid onboarding information, and may return any of the following values: `is_null`, `is_po_box`, `is_false`, and `is_unsupported_value`. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/8f77660cc06b3923af5c8e07dd2f38be).
x-enumDescriptions.extended_review: WePay must perform an extensive review of this merchant before considering re-enabling a capability. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d60a4a5539841d0d04c727435966a58c).
x-enumDescriptions.fraud: WePay has closed this merchant due to fraudulent activity on their account. **Do NOT disclose fraud to any users.** [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/bbb300da4539ebdd4d07cf281dd89851).
x-enumDescriptions.high_risk_cb_rate: WePay has closed this merchant due to high risk or a high rate of [disputes](/api/#/http/api-endpoints/payment-operations/get-a-dispute) (also called charge backs). [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/415c6342dd348a2d4ac1c988aeda7de1).
x-enumDescriptions.identity_verification: WePay requires documentation in order to verify the identity of the entity, controller, or one of the additional representatives. Find exactly which documents are required in the `identity_verification` object. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/c9628ed7085ddc063484d299ce67244b).
x-enumDescriptions.in_review: WePay must review this merchant, and the capability must be disabled until that review is complete. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/2cda740d2644741cc6fc6f4965ff2d4d).
x-enumDescriptions.reported_user: WePay has closed this merchant due to a report received from your platform. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/5fe5fe8bd39e99f5eaa844de4cffbb97).
x-enumDescriptions.risk_outreach: WePay requires documentation in order to properly implement fraud protection for the merchant. Find exactly which documents are required in the `risk_outreach` object. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/6f923c62a95d2c9e9d83b105296749ce).
x-enumDescriptions.tos_violation: WePay has closed this merchant due to activity against [Terms of Service](https://go.wepay.com/terms-of-service-us/). [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/301b57d1094ad11d529b35f263a29cda).
x-enumDescriptions.unsupported: WePay cannot support this merchant. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/733eb21e30e7e823c942b575331da5ec).

x-enumDescriptions.reported_user: WePay has closed this merchant due to a report received from your platform. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/5fe5fe8bd39e99f5eaa844de4cffbb97).

transaction_division_setup.description: Details an Account's onboarding status with Chase Merchant Services.

v3.0.rc.1-capabilities-resp.description: Outlines an account's payment, payout, and terminal capability status, and reasons for any disabled capabilities. **Note:** If your platform does not have permission from WePay to use Card Present, then your merchants' terminal capability will never be enabled. This will not impact their ability to process web-based, card-not-present transactions.

payout_method_id.description: ID of the payout method associated with the USD payout.

x-enumDescriptions.daily: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every day. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.weekly: WePay will pay out an Account for its available balance every week on Monday. If an Account's available balance is $0, then a Payout will not be sent.
x-enumDescriptions.monthly: WePay will send the value of an Account's available balance to the linked Payout Method every month on the 1st, and the available balance will then become $0. If an Account's available balance is already $0, then no Payout will be sent.

period.description: Describes the how often a USD payout will occur.

balances.description: Displays balances pertaining to the merchant account.

description.description: Short description of the merchant account.

x-enumDescriptions.fee_disclosure: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the fee disclosure presented to the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.invoice: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is an invoice presented to the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.tracking: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is for general tracking purposes
x-enumDescriptions.drivers_license: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the driver's license presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.passport: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the passport presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.evidence_of_corporate_registration: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the evidence of corporate registration presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.evidence_of_authority: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the evidence of authority presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_bank_statement: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current bank statement presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.evidence_of_nonprofit_registration: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the evidence of non profit registration presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.social_security_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the social security card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_utility_bill: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current utility bill presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.other_government_issued_photo_id: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is other government issued photo id presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_lease_contract: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current lease contract presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.birth_certificate: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the birth certificate presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.not_applicable: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is not applicable.
x-enumDescriptions.certificate_of_citizenship: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the certificate of citizenship presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.permanent_resident_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the permanent resident card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.employment_authorization_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the employment authorization card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.benefits_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the benefits card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.social_insurance_number_card: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the social insurance number card presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.miscellaneous_compliance_doc: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the miscellaneous compliance document presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.business_report: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the business report presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.negative_media_searches: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the negative media searches presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.person_report: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the person report presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.mortgage_statement: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the mortgage statement presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.certified_copy_of_court_order: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the certified copy of the court order presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.current_local_tax_bill: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the current local tax bill presented by the merchant.
x-enumDescriptions.certificate_of_naturalization: Indicates that the document uploaded and associated with this account is the certificate of naturalization presented by the merchant.

documents.description: An array of documents attached to this merchant to verify fee disclosure.

category_detail.description: Details about the merchant's industry category.

merchant_category_code.description: Category code associated with the merchant's industry.

industry.description: Categorizes the type of service or item a merchant is providing.

name.description: Name of the merchant account; use the "Doing Business As" title for the merchant. Must not contain the word `wepay`. **Note:** Account names can include any regex word character.

platform_onboarding_time.description: The Unix epoch time (in seconds) when the account finished onboarding to the platform.

statement_description.description: A non-empty, ASCII-printable string that does **not** contain the word WePay. This will appear on payers' credit card statements. **Note:** The API allows up to 255 characters, but card issuers will only print 12-14 characters on statements. Find more information [here](/clear/onboard-merchants/).

enhanced_review.description: Indicates if the account is under enhanced review by WePay.

projected_monthly_transaction_volume.description: The projected monthly transaction volume, TPV, of an account.

referral_partner.description: The non ISV partner/solution that refers merchants for payment processing services

holder_name.description: Name of the person as it appears on the credit card or bank account statement.

country_code.description: Country code associated with the legal entity.

phone_number.description: Phone number associated with the legal entity.

x-enumDescriptions.mobile: Indicates that the phone number is for a mobile device.
x-enumDescriptions.personal: Indicates that the phone number is for a personal device.
x-enumDescriptions.business: Indicates that the phone number is for a business device.

payment_bank_ca_holder-req.description: Personal details of the card or account holder.

ca_bank_account_number.description: Account number of the bank account.

ca_bank_branch_code.description: Branch code of the bank account.

ca_bank_institution_code.description: Institution code of the bank account.

x-enumDescriptions.USD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in US dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.CAD: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Canadian dollars.
x-enumDescriptions.GBP: Indicate that this account's default payout should be in Great British pounds. **Note:** Not currently supported.

account_type.description: Indicate if this is a checking or savings account.

x-enumDescriptions.checking: If the payer's bank account is a checking account, they must select this option in order to successfully verify their payment method.
x-enumDescriptions.savings: If the payer's bank account is a savings account, they must select this option in order to successfully verify their payment method.

shared_payment_bank_ca_request.description: Raw bank account information for an account based in Canada being used as a payment method.

enabled.description: Indicates if the capability is enabled.

x-enumDescriptions.account_closed: WePay closed the account. Reach out to WePay for further information. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/f35f0b3bb3a8857fb9523cc75c2d56b4).
x-enumDescriptions.account_deleted: This account has been deleted and off-boarded from a platform due to merchants request. Payments and Payout capabilities are disabled. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/213175f37d147951e2b2a3e299c31e50).
x-enumDescriptions.additional_documents_required: This value indicates that the merchant must [upload documentation](/api/#/http/guides/document-upload) to allow WePay to complete verification. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d251f07f6527155225f87b00e353a029).
x-enumDescriptions.application_block: This issue type will only return if your app has permission to use the application block feature, **and** you have blocked an account's payment or payout capability. x-enumDescriptions.closed_for_loss: WePay has closed this merchant because they maintained a negative account balance for more than 60 days. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/0562f0a5f7f961d662a1d32c66dcc981).
x-enumDescriptions.compliance: WePay has closed this merchant due to regulations which prohibit processing for this merchant. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/857bd478f8126bb0593a3dcfb591b8c6).

current_issues.description: Returns an array of objects identifying why a capability is not enabled. If there is a single issue, the array will contain an `issue_type`; a `target` array with identifying details about the object, path, and/or parameter(s) relevant to the issue; and another array containing further details from the value of `issue_type`. This last array's key will match the value from `issue_type`. If there are multiple issues, then the above collection of objects and parameters will be returned for each issue.  *Note:* Only *one* of the following object will be present, depending on the value of the `issue_type`: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `application_block`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`.

Find out when a controller's email address must be verified [here](/clear/onboard-merchants/#invite-the-controller), and [here](/clear/options/enable-merchants/#enable-payments) for merchants onboarded without the WePay Merchant Center.
x-enumDescriptions.is_null: The target is required information for onboarding, and the merchant must provide this information to continue processing. Find more information in the [Enable Merchants](/clear/options/enable-merchants/) article.
x-enumDescriptions.is_po_box: Addresses must not be a PO box, but rather a residential or business address.
x-enumDescriptions.is_unsupported_value: If a merchant's category code or currency are not supported for a given capability, this issue type will return.
x-enumDescriptions.is_empty: This will return if the JSON path not exist or JSON object is empty

errant_fields.description: Indicates which fields need to be updated.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

current_issues.description: Returns an array of objects identifying why a capability is not enabled. If there is a single issue, the array will contain an `issue_type`; a `target` array with identifying details about the object, path, and/or parameter(s) relevant to the issue; and another array containing further details from the value of `issue_type`. This last array's key will match the value from `issue_type`. If there are multiple issues, then the above collection of objects and parameters will be returned for each issue.  *Note:* Only *one* of the following object will be present, depending on the value of the `issue_type`: `additional_documents_required`, `errant_fields`, `in_review`, `application_block`, `identity_verification`, or `risk_outreach`.

x-enumDescriptions.account_closed: WePay closed the account. Reach out to WePay for further information. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/f35f0b3bb3a8857fb9523cc75c2d56b4).
x-enumDescriptions.account_deleted: This account has been deleted and off-boarded from a platform due to merchants request. Payments and Payout capabilities are disabled. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/213175f37d147951e2b2a3e299c31e50).
x-enumDescriptions.additional_documents_required: This value indicates that the merchant must [upload documentation](/api/#/http/guides/document-upload) to allow WePay to complete verification. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d251f07f6527155225f87b00e353a029).
x-enumDescriptions.application_block: This issue type will only return if your app has permission to use the application block feature, **and** you have blocked an account's payment or payout capability. The `reason` value will be the string submitted by your app when the block was set. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d9e54b7ae580f0e5152dbac6cfaab852).
x-enumDescriptions.closed_for_loss: WePay has closed this merchant because they maintained a negative account balance for more than 60 days. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/0562f0a5f7f961d662a1d32c66dcc981).
x-enumDescriptions.compliance: WePay has closed this merchant due to regulations which prohibit processing for this merchant. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/857bd478f8126bb0593a3dcfb591b8c6).
x-enumDescriptions.country_not_supported: WePay has closed this merchant due to operations in an unsupported country. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/ae635444f872391e08c7bb5d9e7c2277).
x-enumDescriptions.errant_fields: This value describes missing or invalid onboarding information, and may return any of the following values: `is_null`, `is_po_box`, `is_false`, and `is_unsupported_value`. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/8f77660cc06b3923af5c8e07dd2f38be).
x-enumDescriptions.extended_review: WePay must perform an extensive review of this merchant before considering re-enabling a capability. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/d60a4a5539841d0d04c727435966a58c).
x-enumDescriptions.fraud: WePay has closed this merchant due to fraudulent activity on their account. **Do NOT disclose fraud to any users.** [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/bbb300da4539ebdd4d07cf281dd89851).
x-enumDescriptions.high_risk_cb_rate: WePay has closed this merchant due to high risk or a high rate of [disputes](/api/#/http/api-endpoints/payment-operations/get-a-dispute) (also called charge backs). [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/415c6342dd348a2d4ac1c988aeda7de1).
x-enumDescriptions.identity_verification: WePay requires documentation in order to verify the identity of the entity, controller, or one of the additional representatives. Find exactly which documents are required in the `identity_verification` object. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/c9628ed7085ddc063484d299ce67244b).
x-enumDescriptions.in_review: WePay must review this merchant, and the capability must be disabled until that review is complete. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/2cda740d2644741cc6fc6f4965ff2d4d).
x-enumDescriptions.reported_user: WePay has closed this merchant due to a report received from your platform. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/5fe5fe8bd39e99f5eaa844de4cffbb97).
x-enumDescriptions.risk_outreach: WePay requires documentation in order to properly implement fraud protection for the merchant. Find exactly which documents are required in the `risk_outreach` object. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/6f923c62a95d2c9e9d83b105296749ce).
x-enumDescriptions.tos_violation: WePay has closed this merchant due to activity against [Terms of Service](https://go.wepay.com/terms-of-service-us/). [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/301b57d1094ad11d529b35f263a29cda).
x-enumDescriptions.unsupported: WePay cannot support this merchant. [See example notification JSON](https://gist.github.com/wehub/733eb21e30e7e823c942b575331da5ec).

errant_fields.description: Indicates which fields need to be updated.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

path.description: Path to targeted individual (controller, entity, or additional_representative)

requested_documents.description: Types of documents that would fulfill request.

terminals.description: Details an Account's Terminals capability status, and reasons for a disabled status (i.e. `enabled : false`), if applicable. **Note:** If your platform does not have permission from WePay to use Card Present, then your merchants' terminal capability will never be enabled. This will not impact their ability to process web-based, card-not-present transactions.

capabilities-resp.description: Outlines an account's payment, payout, and terminal capability status, and reasons for any disabled capabilities. **Note:** If your platform does not have permission from WePay to use Card Present, then your merchants' terminal capability will never be enabled. This will not impact their ability to process web-based, card-not-present transactions.

type.description: Type of payment method. Possible values include: `credit_card`, `payment_bank_us`, `payment_method_id`, `encoded_payment_method`.

x-enumDescriptions.credit_card: This value is required if the `credit_card` structure is being sent with raw credit card data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_us: This value is required if the `payment_bank_us` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.
x-enumDescriptions.payment_bank_ca: This value is required if the `payment_bank_ca` structure is being sent with the raw bank account data.
x-enumDescriptions.encoded_payment_method: This value is required if the `encoded_payment_method` structure is being sent with the payment blob from the Card Present SDK.
x-enumDescriptions.google_pay: This value is required if the `google_pay` structure is being sent with google pay data.

card_number.description: Card number of the credit card.

expiration_month.description: The month the credit card expires.

expiration_year.description: The year the credit card expires.

auto_update.description: Automatically update credit cards that have been stored with WePay. If a card is expired, or has been replaced (e.g., due to theft), it will be automatically updated based in information provided by card networks. To receive these updates, be sure to [subscribe](/api/latest/operation/POST_notification_preferences/) to the `payment_methods.updated` notification event topic.

card_on_file.description: Indicates if the resulting token will be kept on file as a non-recurring payment method.

cvv.description: Card Verification Value (CVV) of the credit card. Requires permission for CVV optional.

recurring.description: Indicates if the resulting token will be kept on file as a recurring payment method.

trigger_verification.description: Set this parameter to `true` to pre-authorize the card and validate that it is a functional card. This will result in a $0 authorization for Visa, MasterCard, and AmericanExpress cards, and a $0.01 authorization for all other card brands. WePay will not reverse this authorization.

x-enumDescriptions.mobile: Indicates that the virtual terminal transaction was completed in a Card Present environment.
x-enumDescriptions.web: Indicates that the virtual terminal transaction was completed in a Card Not Present environment.

virtual_terminal_mode.description: This is set if the merchant manually entered the credit card number. Possible values include: `mobile`, `web`, null.

encoded_payment_method.description: Encoded payment data. Currently is used for POS payment tokens but in future may be used for other types of encoded payment information

payment_method_data.description: Base64 converted [JSON data](https://developers.google.com/pay/api/web/reference/response-objects#PaymentData) received from Google Pay APIs.

public_key.description: Public key received from WePay during your application on-boarding.

google_pay.description: Credit card payment method information for Google Pay.

appIdAuth.name: App-Id
appIdAuth.description: Find your app ID in your dashboard at [partner.wepay.com](https://partner.wepay.com/).

appTokenAuth.name: App-Token
appTokenAuth.description: Find or generate a token in your dashboard at [partner.wepay.com](https://partner.wepay.com/).
